The causes declared in their announcement that Allah is behind them, and that they are not connected to their Creator, for the artifact does not know its Maker, nor are they separated from their Sustainer, for from Him they receive their harms and benefits.

He created the spirits (الأرواح) and the angels (الأملاك), and raised the heavens, a dome above a dome, upon the pillars of the Human (عمد الإنسان). He set the celestial spheres (الأفلاك) in motion and spread out the Earth (دحا الأرض) to distinguish between elevation and depression. He designated the world (الدنيا) as a path to the Hereafter (الآخرة). He sent His messengers in succession (تترى) because of the incapacity and deficiency He created in the intellects regarding the knowledge of what Allah created of the bodies, spirits, subtleties, and densities of the Cosmos (العالم).

Indeed, the knowledge of the arrangement (الوضع) and ordering (الترتيب) is not the lot of reflective thought (الفكر); rather, it depends upon the report of the Agent (الفاعل) who made them and the Originator (المنشئ) of their forms. The knowledge related to the intellect (العقل) through reflective thought is only the *possibility* (إمكان) of that, not its ordering. For the ordering is known only through witnessing (الشهود) in the particulars (الأشخاص), such that one says: this is above this, and this is below this, and this is before this, and this is after this. The intellect judges the possibility of all of that.

Then, Allah Almighty ordained in the Upper World (العالم العلوي) the measures (المقادير), the weights (الأوزان), the movements (الحركات), and the stillness (السكون) in the state, the locus, the place, and the occupant. He created the heavens and made them like domes over the Earth, a dome above a dome, as we shall show you in this chapter concerning the form of the arrangement of the world of bodies (عالم الأجرام). He made these heavens stationary and created stars within them, assigning them measured movements (حركات مقدرة) in their course and swimming (سباحتها) within these heavens, movements that neither increase nor decrease. He made them intelligent, hearing, and obedient, and <<He revealed in every heaven its command (أَوْحى‏ في كُلِّ سَماءٍ أَمْرَها)>>.

Then, when Allah assigned swimming to the stars in these heavens, paths were created for their movement, a path for every planet. This is His saying: <<By the heaven containing the paths (وَالسَّماءِ ذاتِ الْحُبُكِ)>>. These paths were named celestial spheres (أفلاك). The spheres come into existence with the existence of the movement of the planets. They move swiftly within the body of the heaven, which is their expanse. They penetrate the air adjacent to them, and their movement produces sounds and melodious tunes because their movement follows a known measure (وزن معلوم). These are the melodies of the spheres (نغمات الأفلاك) resulting from the planets traversing the celestial distances. They run in these paths according to a continuous custom. The measures of these movements and their entry upon one another in their course have been known through observation (الرصد). He made their movement appear to the observer as being between slowness and speed, and He assigned them progression and regression in known places in the heaven. The bodies of the planets define those places, for the bodies of the heavens are similar in their parts. Were it not for the illumination of the planets, their progression or regression would not be known. It is these that the sight perceives, and it perceives their movement and return.

The masters of the science of configuration (علم الهيئة) established an arrangement for the spheres that is permissible and possible according to the judgment of the intellect. The observation of the planets, their movement, progression, regression, slowness, and speed gave them this knowledge. They attributed this to the revolving spheres (الأفلاك الدائرة بها). They made the planets in the heavens like moles on the surface of the human body, or like leprosy due to their whiteness. Everything they said provides the measure of their movements. If Allah Almighty had done this exactly as they described, the movement would be the movement itself. That is why they are correct in the science of eclipses and the entry of the spheres upon one another. Likewise, the paths enter upon one another in the locus where the movement of the travelers occurs. Thus, they are correct regarding the measures (الأوزان) but mistaken in believing that the matter is arranged exactly as they ordered it, and that the heavens are like spheres (الأكر), and that the Earth is inside the hollow of these spheres.

Allah assigned to these planets, and to some of them, a known, measured stopping (وقوفا) at specific times, a custom (العادة) that Allah has not broken, so that the master of observation (صاحب الرصد) may know some of what Allah revealed of His command in the heaven. All of this is a conventional arrangement (ترتيب وضعي) whose opposite is possible, despite these measures. The matter is only as we have mentioned through witnessing (شهودا) and unveiling (كشفا).

Then, Allah Almighty causes, upon these planetary movements in these celestial paths, events in the world of elements (عالم الأركان) and in the generated things (المولدات), matters from what He revealed in the command of the heaven. He made this a continuous custom (عادة مستمرة), a trial (ابتلاء) by which Allah tests His servants. Some people attribute that effect accompanying this movement to Allah Almighty, and some people attribute it to the movement of the planet and its ray (شعاعه), because they see that the world of elements is the landing place of the rays of the planets. <<As for those who believed in Allah, it increased them in faith (إِيماناً بِالله)>>. But as for those who believed in falsehood (الباطل), it increased them in faith in falsehood, and they disbelieved in Allah, and they are the losers, <<whose trade did not profit, and they were not guided (فَما رَبِحَتْ تِجارَتُهُمْ وما كانُوا مُهْتَدِينَ)>>.

### [Indeed, Allah Almighty assigned angels to the wombs at the descent of the drops]

Then, Allah Almighty assigned angels to the wombs (الأرحام) at the descent of the drops (مساقط النطف). They transform the drops from state to state, as Allah has legislated for them, and He measured that transformation by months. This is His saying: <<And what the wombs diminish (وما تَغِيضُ الْأَرْحامُ)>>—meaning what they decrease from the customary number—<<and what they increase (وما تَزْدادُ)>> from the customary number. <<And everything with Him is by measure (وَكُلُّ شَيْ‏ءٍ عِنْدَهُ بِمِقْدارٍ)>>.

He, the Glorified, knows the individuality (شخصية) of every person, and the individuality of his action, movements, and stillness. He linked this to the celestial planetary movements. Thus, those who attribute the effects to them do so because Allah placed the effects *at* them, not *from* them. No one knows what is in the wombs, nor what is being created from the drops that have not yet been created, according to a known measure, except Allah Almighty and those whom Allah informs, such as the angels assigned to the wombs. This is why the celestial planetary movement may be singular, yet diverse matters occur simultaneously in the elements and generated things—matters that are innumerable and cannot be reached by observation in the particulars of the elemental world (العالم العنصري), because Allah has placed it upon diverse temperaments (أمزجة مختلفة), even though it originates from a single source. Just as we know that Allah created humanity from a single soul (نفس واحدة), Adam, yet He made us different in our intellects and varying in our perspectives, though the origin is one. Among us are the good and the wicked, the white and the black, and what is between them, the broad-tempered and the narrow, distressed-tempered.

The Origin is singular, and the branches are many;
The Real (الحق) is the root, and existence (الكيان) is the branches.

Allah created the Cosmos (العالم) external to the Human only as an example (ضرب مثال) for the Human, so that he may know that everything that appears in the Cosmos is within him. The Human (الإنسان) is the intended Essence (العين المقصودة). He is the totality of wisdom. For his sake, Paradise and Hell, the world and the Hereafter, all states and qualities were created. In him appeared the totality of the Divine Names (الأسماء الإلهية) and their effects. He is the one who is blessed, tormented, shown mercy, and punished. Then, He granted him the ability to torment, bless, show mercy, and punish. He is the responsible agent (المكلف), the chooser (المختار), yet he is compelled (مجبور) in his choice. To him, the Real (الحق) discloses Himself through judgment (الحكم), decree (القضاء), and decision (الفصل). Upon him revolves the entire Cosmos. For his sake, the Resurrection (القيامة) occurred, and through him, the Jinn were taken, and for him, what is in the heavens and what is on the earth was subjugated. The entire Cosmos, high and low, world and Hereafter, moves for his need.

He made the species of this Human vary in degrees. He subjugated some of them to others, and subjugated him to some of the Cosmos, so that the benefit returns to him. He is subjugated only for his own sake, and the other benefits incidentally. Allah did not single out any of His creation for the Vicegerency (الخلافة) except this human species. He granted him mastery over the reins of withholding and giving. The fortunate ones (السعداء) are Vicegerents (خلفاء) and deputies (نواب). Those below the fortunate ones are deputies, not Vicegerents. They act as deputies for the Divine Names in the manifestation of the effects of their rulings in the Cosmos through their hands. Thus, they are Vicegerents in the inner dimension (الباطن) and deputies in the outer dimension (الظاهر). The deputy is the one who appears by night because he is a deputy, not a Divine Vicegerent by legal designation, and he is concealed by day.

From the wisdom of the change in the prescribed ruling, it is known that the volitional law (الشرع الإرادي) is veiled in its injustice. Since the rulers among creation are Vicegerents and deputies, as we established, Allah clarified, through what the Real legislated, the truth from falsehood (الباطل) and what benefits from what harms among the apparent and hidden actions. He divided the work between the limbs and the heart. Allah made the hearts the locus for the Real and falsehood, faith and disbelief, knowledge and ignorance.

Falsehood (الباطل), disbelief (الكفر), and ignorance (الجهل) are destined for decay and disappearance, because their ruling has no fixed entity (عين) in Existence (الوجود). It is non-existence (عدم) that has an apparent ruling and a known form. That ruling and that form seek an existential matter (أمرا وجوديا) upon which to rely, but they do not find it, so they decay and become non-existent. Therefore, the ultimate destination is happiness (السعادة). Faith (الإيمان), the Real (الحق), and Knowledge (العلم) rely upon an existential matter in the fixed entity (في العين), which is Allah, the Mighty and Majestic. Thus, their ruling is established in the fixed entity—that is, in the fixed entity of the one upon whom they are judged—because the one who preserves the existence of this ruling is existent; rather, He is the very Essence of Existence (عين الوجود), who is Allah, named by these Names and described by these Attributes. He is the Real, the Knowing, the Believer (المؤمن). Thus, faith relies on the believer, knowledge on the knowing one, and the Real on the Real. Allah Almighty did not name Himself with Falsehood due to its existence, nor with the Ignorant or the Disbeliever—exalted is Allah far above these Names.

The Divine Books and Scrolls descended upon the hearts of the believing Vicegerents, subjects, and inheritors. Their benefit flowed into every heart that was a locus for every good thing. As for the accidental matters (الأمور العوارض) that are not revealed by a Divinely legislated command, they are whims (أهواء) that occur to the deputies and subjects, called injustice (جورا). Accidental things have no permanence, so their ruling vanishes when they vanish. The fixed entity (العين) that existed before them and was described by them is existent, and it must have a state by which it is described. Misery (الشقاء) has departed from it due to the disappearance of its cause, since the cause was an accident that occurred. Therefore, its opposite must follow, which is called happiness (السعادة).

Whoever enters the Fire (النار) among them enters it only so that his impurity (خبثه) may be negated and his goodness (طيبه) may remain. When the impurity is gone and the goodness remains, that is the one referred to as the happy one (السعيد) whose happiness was consumed within his impurity. This is the matter in itself. Only one with two eyes, not one eye, knows the measure of what we have established. He who stands between the two high roads (النجدين) sees the goal of each path. He travels the path of his happiness (سعادتة) which no misery precedes, for it is an easy, white, pure path, without blemish, crookedness, or unevenness. The other path, although its goal is happiness, contains deserts, perils, aggressive beasts, and harmful snakes. No creature reaches its goal without enduring these horrors. The two paths are adjacent, emanating from a single origin and ending at a single origin, separating only between the two origins, between the beginning and the end.

The owner of the clear path (صاحب المحجة البيضاء) witnesses what is on his companion's path because he is sighted (بصير), while his companion is blind (أعمى). The blind one does not see the path of the sighted one. The sighted one experiences fears from witnessing the afflictions on the blind one's path, due to the horrors he sees, and he imagines what he would endure if he were there. He sees that the blind one has no knowledge of any of this, due to his blindness. He sees nothing, so he walks, enjoying his journey, until he falls into a pit or is bitten by one of those snakes. It is then that he feels pain and cries out to his companion. Some companions rescue him, and some have gone ahead and do not hear him. He remains distressed as long as Allah wills, then Allah has mercy on him and makes him happy.

The animal, by virtue of being an animal, feels pain and pleasure. The rational being, the Human, knows the painful cause and the pleasurable cause through customary experience (ذوقا من العادة). A group has erred in this, making the pain inherent (ذاتيا) to the painful cause, which is not the case. What causes the Human pain or pleasure is the existence of the pain or pleasure *in* him intellectually, not its cause. This is concerning customary pains and pleasures. There are other causes that the intellect cannot grasp independently. Allah informs the Human of them through the tongue of His Messenger by revelation (الوحي). He knows them, so he performs what Allah commanded him to perform and avoids what Allah commanded him to avoid. He already knows pain and pleasure intellectually, so he recalls them when he learns of these legal causes (الأسباب الشرعية) that necessitate them.

Whoever obeys, obeys with insight (بصيرة) into his command. Whoever disobeys, and knows he is disobeying, disobeys with insight into the disobedience, but he is *not* on insight regarding the accountability (المؤاخذة) for it, as he is on insight regarding the reward for obedience. What emboldened him to commit the transgression (المعصية) by the pre-ordained decree (بالقدر السابق) is his lack of insight into the accountability. It is not proper for the believer—indeed, it is not sound—to have insight into the accountability for disobedience, because Divine Mercy (الرحمة الإلهية) and Forgiveness (المغفرة) are more deserving than vengeance and retribution, except for what Allah has specified as a particular attribute, such that whoever dies while it is established in him deserves accountability, and this is inevitable. This is only association (الشرك). Everything other than association, Allah has placed under His Will (المشيئة). Therefore, no one can rightly have insight into the punishment. This is what emboldened souls to commit prohibitions and enter into sin, except for those whom Allah protected.

Protection comes through fear, hope, shame, or protection in Allah's knowledge (عصمة في علم الله) outside of these three. There is no fifth to these four preventatives against falling into transgression and exposing oneself to punishment. The possible (الممكن) has a covenant with Allah to accept every possibility by its essence. Whoever fulfills this covenant with Allah will undoubtedly be made happy initially. If he breaks Allah's covenant in this and turns the possible into the impossible (محالا) or the necessary (واجبا), he has departed from what he covenanted with Allah and exposed himself to what he imagined would not befall him. Such a person is one who rejected the call of the Real (دعوة الحق) brought by the Messenger from Allah, like the Brahmins and those who hold their view.

### [The Perfect Human is the Pillar of the Heaven]

Know that since the Perfect Human (الإنسان الكامل) is the pillar of the heaven (عمد السماء) by whose existence Allah <<holds the heaven from falling upon the earth (يُمْسِكُ الله بوجوده السَّماءَ أَنْ تَقَعَ عَلَى الْأَرْضِ)>>, when the Perfect Human departs and moves to the Isthmus (البرزخ), the heaven collapses. This is His saying: <<And the heaven is split, and on that Day it is frail (وانْشَقَّتِ السَّماءُ فَهِيَ يَوْمَئِذٍ واهِيَةٌ)>>—meaning falling to the Earth.

The heaven is a transparent, solid body. When it collapses, the heat of the Fire dissolves its body, and it returns to a red smoke, like molten grease (كالدهان السائل), like a flame of fire, just as it was the first time. The light of the sun vanishes, and the stars are extinguished, having no light left, except that their swimming does not cease in the Fire—no, rather, they are scattered, and they are not upon the order (النظام) they had in the world. They will issue rulings upon the people of the Fire according to what Allah revealed in them, because the Hereafter is the renewal of another creation (نشأة أخرى) in totality, which the First Intellect (العقل الأول) and the Preserved Tablet (اللوح المحفوظ) do not know.

For this reason, the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said that he will praise Allah on the Day of Resurrection at the Praised Station (المقام المحمود) with praises that he does not know now. Allah will teach them to him on that Day, according to the ruling of the Divine Names that manifests then, which no one knows today. The creation (نشأة الخلق) and their states, and what will occur from them in the Resurrection and the Two Abodes (الدارين), are different from the creation of the world, even if they resemble it in form. Therefore, He said: <<And you have already known the first creation (النَّشْأَةَ الْأُولى‏); why then do you not remember?>> that it was without precedent. Likewise, He will create you in what you do not know on the Day of Resurrection.

Let us mention in this chapter a portion of the configuration of Hell (جهنم) and the configuration of the Gardens (الجنات) and what is in them that we did not mention in their respective chapters previously. Let us put all of this into examples (أمثلة) so that the visualization may be easier for those who cannot conceive of meanings without striking a similitude, just as Allah struck a similitude for the hearts with valleys according to their measure in the descent of water, and just as He struck the similitude for His Light with a lamp. All of this is to bring the matter closer to weak understandings. This is His saying: <<He created the Human, He taught him the clear expression (عَلَّمَهُ الْبَيانَ)>> by what He clarified for him, so he knew how to clarify for others.

We say that when the body filled the void (الخلأ), the first shape it accepted was circularity (الاستدارة). He named that circularity the celestial sphere (فلك). In that circle appeared the forms of the entire Cosmos, its lowest and highest, its subtle and its dense, what is contained in space (يتحيز) and what is not. That which filled the void is not contained in space (غير متحيز) and is not in a place, nor does it accept place. Were it not for the Real (الحق) being described by encompassing (الإحاطة), the intellect would not have imagined the containment of this total body (الجسم الكل) in the void. The void was only imagined from the witnessing of the sensible body. Likewise, the containment of the possibles (الممكنات) was not imagined, even though they are inherently non-ending. What has been found of them is finite. This includes the First Intellect (العقل الأول) and everything that is not contained in space and does not accept place. It should have been said concerning what is not contained in space that it is non-ending, because finitude is only conceived in existing place and time. Something that is not contained in space has been found, so how can finitude be conceived in it?

Likewise, what entered into Existence (الوجود) of the Levels (المراتب), even if they are non-existence (عدما), they are imagined existence. The Levels are non-existential relations (نسب عدمية); they are the station where everything, existent or non-existent, is placed by ruling in its rank, whether it is Necessary of Existence by its Essence (واجب الوجود لذاته), Necessary of Existence by another, or Impossible of Existence (محال الوجود). Pure non-existence has a rank, pure Existence has a rank, and pure possibility has a rank. Each rank is distinct from the other. Therefore, the imagined and conceived containment is necessary. All known things (المعلومات) in Allah's Knowledge are as they are. He knows Himself and knows others. His Existence is not described by finitude. What has not entered into Existence is not described by finitude. The genera (الأجناس) are finite and are known by His Knowledge. Knowledge encompasses what is finite and what is non-finite, while Knowledge contains it. It is here that intellects become bewildered in their thoughts.

Then, if you verify the matter, the Real (الحق) has included Himself in the description by which He described Himself concerning locality (الظرفية). He described Himself as being in the Cloud (العماء), upon the Throne (العرش), in the heaven, and on the earth. He described Himself with the Before and with Companionship (المعية) and with everything. He made Himself the very Essence (عين) of everything by His saying: <<Everything is perishing except His Face (كُلُّ شَيْ‏ءٍ هالِكٌ إِلَّا وَجْهَهُ)>>. Then He said: <<To Him belongs the Judgment (لَهُ الْحُكْمُ)>>, which is what appeared in the essence of things. Then He said: <<And to Him you will be returned (وإِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ)>>, meaning your return from being others (أغيارا) is to Me, so the ruling of otherness vanishes. There is nothing in Existence but Me.

We clarify this with the example of the Human (الإنسان), with all his details and his being described by varying rulings: life, sensation, faculties, and limbs differing in movements, and everything related to this named Human. These fixed entities (الأعيان) in which these rulings appear are not something other than the Human. Thus, these rulings return to the Human. The rulings in the Real (الحق) are the forms of the entire Cosmos, what has appeared of it and what will appear. The rulings originate from Him and belong to Him. That is why He said: <<To Him belongs the Judgment (لَهُ الْحُكْمُ)>>. Then, everything returns to the fact that He is its Essence. He is the Judge of every ruling in everything, a self-ruling (حكما ذاتيا) that cannot be otherwise.

He named Himself with His Names, so He judged upon Himself by them. He named what appeared through Him of the Divine Rulings in the fixed entities of things to distinguish some from others, just as He distinguished the body of the Human from his spirit. The Human is only the totality of both. Just as He is named the Creator (خالقا) by Him and by His creation, the spirit of the Human is not said to be the essence of the Human nor other than him. Likewise, concerning his realities, necessities, and accidents, the hand of the Human or any of his limbs is not said to be the essence of the Human nor other than the Human. Similarly, the fixed entities of the Cosmos are not said to be the essence of the Real nor other than the Real. Rather, all Existence (الوجود كله) is the Real (حق), but some of the Real is described as created (مخلوق), and some is described as uncreated. But every existent thing is described as being judged by such-and-such.

We say concerning Allah that <<He is Independent of the Worlds (غَنِيٌّ عَنِ الْعالَمِينَ)>>, so we judged upon Him with this attribute. We said concerning what is named other than Him that it is poor toward Allah, so we judged upon it. All are judged upon. Just as we judged everything to be perishing (هلاك), and we judged His Face (وجهه) to be an exception from the ruling of perishing. He is the first one judged upon from the essence of His Ipseity (هويته). Among what He judged upon His Ipseity is that He described Himself as having a *nafas* (breath), and He attributed it to the Name *al-Rahman* (the Merciful) so that we may know, when our fixed entities appear and His envoys convey this matter to us, the comprehensiveness and universality of Mercy, and that people and all creation incline toward it. For only the recipient of mercy (المرحوم) appears from *al-Rahman*. Understand this.

The *nafas* (breath) is the first unseen thing (غيب) that appeared to Himself. In it was the Real (الحق) from His Name the Lord (الرب), like the Throne (العرش) today upon which He established Himself by the Name *al-Rahman*. It is the first dense, transparent, luminous thing that appeared. When it became distinct from what it appeared from—and it is not other than Him—He made it a vessel (ظرفا) for Himself, because only His Essence can be a vessel for Him. The ruling of the void (الخلأ) appeared with the appearance of this *nafas*. Were it not for that, we would not have spoken of a void.

Then, He brought into existence in this Cloud (العماء) all the forms of the Cosmos, concerning which He said that it is perishing (هالك)—meaning in terms of its forms—<<except His Face (إِلَّا وَجْهَهُ)>>—meaning except for its Reality (حقيقته), for it is not perishing and cannot perish. An example to bring this closer: If the form of the Human perishes and no trace of it remains in Existence, his Reality (حقيقته), which is distinguished by the definition (الحد), does not perish. It is the very definition for him. We say: "The Human is a rational animal," and we do not concern ourselves with whether he is existent or non-existent, for this Reality remains his, even if he has no form in Existence. The known thing does not vanish from Knowledge. Knowledge is the vessel of the known things (المعلومات).

The form of the entire Cosmos is a circular, spherical form. Within it, the forms of shapes varied: squaring, tripling, sextupling, to what is non-ending in ruling, not in existence. The angels surrounding the Throne (الملائكة الحافون من حول العرش) have no swimming except in this circular Cloud (العماء) in which the essence of the Throne also appeared, squared, with its legs and its bearers, from the forms of meanings and the forms of their bodies, which are the letters (الحروف) indicating them. For the meaning is only inferred from the ruling of its form, which is the letter, and the letter is only known in terms of its meaning. Thus, He is the Knower, the Knowledge, the Known (العالم العلم المعلوم).

There is nothing in Existence but the One (الواحد) and the Many (الكثير). In it appeared the bewildered angels (الملائكة المهيمة), the Intellect (العقل), the Soul (النفس), and the Nature (الطبيعية). Nature is the most deserving of being related to the Real (الحق) than anything else, for everything other than it appeared only within what appeared from it, which is the *nafas* (breath), which permeates the Cosmos—meaning in the forms of the Cosmos. By this ruling, the Real's Self-disclosure (تجلى الحق) occurs in the forms He mentioned about Himself, for whoever understands from Him what He reported about Himself, the Exalted.

Look at the universality of the ruling of Nature (الطبيعية) and look at the deficiency of the ruling of the Intellect (العقل), because the Intellect is, in reality, a form of the forms of Nature, or rather, a form of the forms of the Cloud (العماء), and the Cloud is a form of Nature. Those who placed the rank of Nature below the Soul (النفس) and above the Prime Matter (الهيولى) did so due to their lack of witnessing things, even if they are people of witnessing. They mean by it the nature that appeared by its ruling in the transparent bodies of the Throne (العرش) and what it contains. This nature is related to the Greater Nature as a daughter is related to the woman who is the mother. She gives birth just as her mother gives birth, and although the daughter is born from her, she has a birth-giving capacity over everyone born from her. Likewise, the elements (العناصر) close to us are the nature of what is born from them. Likewise, the humors (الأخلاط) in the animal body. Therefore, we named it Nature, just as we call the daughter and daughters female and collect them as females.

We mentioned this to introduce the shapes we will present for striking similitudes, to bring closer to the limited understandings (الأفهام القاصرة) the grasp of meanings without an example. Allah only made the Human's knowledge of himself an example for the knowledge of his Lord, for if he did not know himself, he would not know his Lord.

This is the form of the Cloud (العماء), which is the true, universal, natural body (الجسم الحقيقي العام الطبيعي), which is a form of the power of Nature (الطبيعية). It disclosed itself for the forms that appear in it. The only rank above it is the rank of Lordship (الربوبية), which sought the form of the Cloud from the Name *al-Rahman* (the Merciful), so He breathed (تنفس), and the Cloud came into being. The Law (الشرع) likened it to us by what was mentioned concerning this Name. When we understood its form by approximation, He said: "Above it is air that rises above it"—meaning above it is only the Real (حق). "And below it is air upon which it relies"—meaning there is nothing below it. Then things appeared in it. The Cloud is the origin of all things and all forms. It is the first branch that appeared from the Origin. It is a star, not a tree. Then trees branched out from it to the end of the Command and Creation, which is the Earth. That is by the decree of the Almighty, the All-Knowing.

This struck, shaped, and represented similitude that we strike and shape is the Cloud (العماء). It is the encompassing circle (الدائرة المحيطة).

The signs and points (الإشارات والنقط) in the circle are the example of the fixed entities (أعيان) of the bewildered spirits (الأرواح المهيمة). The Great Point (النقطة العظمى) among these points is the Intellect (العقل). The circle next to the Great Point, inside which are two points, is the Universal Soul (النفس الكل) and the Preserved Tablet (اللوح المحفوظ). Those two points contain the two faculties: the cognitive (العلمية) and the operative (العملية). The four points adjacent to the circle of the Soul are the rank of Nature (الطبيعة), which is the daughter of the Greater Nature. The circle inside this Great Circle is the substance of Prime Matter (جوهر الهيولى), which is the Dust (الهباء). The square shape within it is the Throne (العرش). The circle inside this square shape is the Footstool (الكرسي), the place of the two feet. The circle inside it is the Starless Sphere (الفلك الأطلس). The eight circles are the Gardens (الجنات). The circle below the eight is the Starry Sphere (الفلك المكوكب), the sphere of the Mansions (فلك المنازل). Below its concave surface is Hell (جهنم). In what is below its concave surface, the shapes of the heavens, the earth, and what is between them of the elements (الأركان) and fixed stars opened up. All of that is Hell.

When the heaven and the earth are changed (بدلت), the change occurs in the forms, not in the fixed entities (الأعيان). Although the fixed entities are forms, if the intended meaning is known, there is no dispute over words and expressions. The two lines beneath the square shape called the Throne: one line is the Water (الماء) and the other is the Air (الهواء). The description of the circles inside the Starry Sphere are the Heavens (السموات). The lines upon which the ends of the semi-circles rest are the Earth (الأرض). Between the dome in the first line of the Earth lines are three lines in red, which are the three elements (الأركان): Water, Air, and Fire. The designated measures in the Starless Sphere are the Zodiacal Signs (البروج). The designated measures in the Starry Sphere are the Lunar Mansions (المنازل). Every dome of the seven domes has a red point, which is the form of the planet of that dome.

Then, everything inside the Starry Sphere transforms in the Hereafter into forms other than these forms. Inside the Starry Sphere will be the Gathering (الحشر), the Resurrection (النشر), and the Reckoning (الحساب), and the Throne (العرش) where the Real discloses Himself for decision and judgment (الفصل والقضاء). The angels on that Earth will be seven rows before that Throne. Humans and Jinn will be between the Throne and the rows of angels. The Bridge (الصراط) is erected like the line that divides the circle into two halves, ending at the meadow (المرج) outside the wall of Paradise, the place of the banquet (المأدبة) that the people of Paradise eat before entering Paradise and after crossing the Bridge.

I shall draw all of this and its likes and write the name of the intended meaning on every shape. This includes the form of the Cloud and what it contains up to the Throne of Establishment (عرش الاستواء), for the space for the forms of the shapes is narrow here and does not suffice for the forms we wish to draw in a single diagram. If it were wider, it would be clearer to the observer.

This includes the form of the Throne of Establishment, the Footstool (الكرسي), the Two Feet, the Water upon which the Throne rests, the Air that holds the Water, and the Darkness. This includes the form of the Starless Sphere, the Gardens, the surface of the Starry Sphere, and the Tuba Tree. This includes the form of the Starry Sphere, the domes of the heavens, what they rest upon (which is the Earth), the three elements, the pillar by which Allah holds the dome, the mineral, the plant, the animal, and the human. This includes the form of the Earth of Gathering (أرض المحشر) and what it contains of fixed entities and levels, the Throne of Decision and Judgment, its bearers, and the rows of angels. This includes the form of Hell, its gates, stations, and levels. This includes the form of the Presence of the Divine Names (حضرة الأسماء الإلهية), the world, the Hereafter, and the Isthmus (البرزخ). This includes the form of the Dune of Vision (كثيب الرؤية) and the ranks of creation therein. This includes the form of the entire Cosmos and the arrangement of its layers: spirit and body, high and low.

We shall speak about each form in nine sections, corresponding to the nine faces of the illustration. I have not arranged them in order of precedence or sequence, but the discussion of them will clarify what is prior and posterior, and what is general and detailed.

### Section One: On the Mention of the Cloud and what it Contains up to the Throne of Establishment

Know that Allah is described by Existence (الوجود), and nothing with Him of the possibles (الممكنات) is described by Existence. Rather, I say that the Real (الحق) is the very Essence of Existence (عين الوجود). This is the saying of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him: "Allah was, and there was nothing with Him."

He says: Allah is existent, and nothing of the Cosmos is existent. He mentioned concerning Himself the beginning of this matter—meaning the appearance of the Cosmos in His Essence (في عينه). This is because Allah Almighty loved to be known (أحب أن يعرف) so that He might bestow upon the Cosmos the knowledge of Him, the Mighty and Majestic. He knew that He, the Exalted, is not known from the perspective of His Ipseity (هويته) nor from the perspective by which He knows Himself. The only knowledge of Him that can be attained in the Cosmos is for the Cosmos to know that it does not know Him. This measure is called knowledge, as the Veracious One (الصديق) said: "Incapacity to grasp the perception is perception," since it is known that there is a matter in Existence that is not known, which is Allah.

Especially for the possibles (الممكنات), in that they have fixed entities (أعيانا ثابتة) that are not existent, co-eternal with the Necessary of Existence (واجب الوجود) in pre-eternity (الأزل). Just as we have an auditory, established relation (تعلقا سمعيا ثبوتيا), not an existential one, with the address of the Real when He addresses us, and just as they have the power of compliance, they likewise have all the faculties of knowledge, sight, and others—every established and verified ruling (حكم محقق) that is non-existential. The vision of those who see them among the existents relates to and through those fixed entities, just as they see themselves with an established vision.

When He was described by Love (المحبة), and Love is a ruling that necessitates mercy (رحمة) upon the one described by it, the one who breathes finds comfort in his breathing. The emergence of the breath (النفس) from the breather is the very essence of his mercy upon himself. Nothing emerged from Him, the Exalted, except the Mercy that <<encompassed everything (وَسِعَتْ كُلَّ شَيْ‏ءٍ)>>. It extended over the entire Cosmos, what was and what will not be, to what is non-ending.

The first form that accepted the Breath of the Merciful (نفس الرحمن) is the form of the Cloud (العماء). It is a Merciful vapor (بخار رحماني); in it is Mercy, rather, it is the very Essence of Mercy. That was the first vessel (ظرف) that accepted the Existence of the Real (وجود الحق). The Real was to it like the heart to the Human, just as He, the Exalted, is to the heart of the Gnostic believer like the heart to the Human. He is the Heart of the Heart, just as He is the King of the King. Nothing contained Him but Himself, so there was none but Him.

Then, the substance of that Cloud accepted the forms of the spirits (الأرواح) from comfort and finding rest in them. These are the bewildered spirits (الأرواح المهيمة). They knew nothing other than the substance in which and by which they appeared, which is their origin, the inner dimension (باطن) and the Unseen (غيبه) of the Real. It appeared, and the Cosmos appeared in it and by it, for it is impossible for the Cosmos to appear from the ruling of the inner dimension. The appearance of a reality (حق) is necessary, by which the forms of the Cosmos appear. There was nothing but the Cloud. It is the Manifest Name (الاسم الظاهر), *al-Rahman*. They were bewildered within themselves.

Then, He showed one of these spiritual forms, through a special cognitive Self-disclosure (تجلي خاص علمي), the knowledge of what will be until the Day of Resurrection, which the bewildered spirits do not know. It found within its essence a power by which it was distinguished from the rest of the spirits. It witnessed them, but they did not witness it, nor did they witness one another. It saw itself as composed of itself and the power it found. By this power, it knew how its emanation (صدوره) occurred.

It knew that in Knowledge there are intelligible realities (حقائق معقولات). It named them intelligibles because it grasped them (عقلها) when they became distinct to it. It was not possible for each of them to be the essence of the other. They are known things (معلومات) for the Real, and intelligibles for the Real and for themselves. They have no existence in existential existence (الوجود الوجودي) nor in possible existence (الوجود الإمكانى). Their ruling appears in the Real, so they are attributed to Him and are called Divine Names (أسماء إلهية). The attributes of pre-eternity (نعوت الأزل) are attributed to them, just as they are attributed to the Real. They are also attributed to Creation (الخلق) by the ruling that appears from them in it. The attributes of origination (نعوت الحدوث) are attributed to them, just as they are attributed to Creation. Thus, they are the originated-eternal (الحادثة القديمة) and the everlasting-pre-eternal (الأبدية الأزلية).

This Intellect (العقل) then knew that the Real only brought the Cosmos into existence within the Cloud (العماء). It saw that the Cloud is the Breath of the Merciful (نفس الرحمن). It said: Two matters are necessary, which are called in theoretical knowledge (العلم النظري) two premises (مقدمتين) for the manifestation of a third matter, which is the result of the coupling of those two premises. It saw that it possessed something of the Real that the bewildered spirits did not possess. It knew that it was closer in suitability to the Real than the rest of the spirits.

It saw in the substance of the Cloud the form of the Perfect Human (الإنسان الكامل), who is to the Real like the shadow of a person to the person. It saw itself deficient in relation to that degree. It already knew what would be constituted from it of the Cosmos until its end in the world and in the generated things. It knew that it must attain the degree of perfection (الكمال) that belongs to the Perfect Human, even if it is not *like* the Human in it. Perfection in the Perfect Human is *in act* (بالفعل), while in the First Intellect (العقل الأول) it is *in potential* (بالقوة). What is in act is more perfect in Existence than what is only in potential without act. For this reason, the worker found in his essence the capacity to bring it out from potentiality to actuality, so that he might be described by the perfection of capability. If it were possible to bring all the possibles into existence, He would not have left a single one of them described by non-existence. But that is impossible due to non-finitude. What enters into Existence must be finite.

The Real disclosed Himself to it, and it saw two shadows (ظلالان) for its Essence. That Self-disclosure (التجلي) was like the speech to Moses from the side of the Mount. Likewise, the Divine Self-disclosure to this Intellect was from the right side, for Allah has two blessed, outstretched Hands (يدين مباركتين مبسوطتين)—meaning they contain Mercy. He did not couple them with anything of punishment. He gives a Mercy that He extends, and He gives a Mercy that He contracts. Contraction is drawing it near to Him, and extension is dissolution within it.

That shadow (الظل) extending from the essence of the Intellect, from the light of that Self-disclosure and the density of the originated thing (المحدث) in relation to the Subtle, the All-Aware, was a Soul (نفسا), which is the Preserved Tablet (اللوح المحفوظ). The essential Nature (الطبيعة الذاتية) is with all of that. It is called there Life, Knowledge, Will, and Speech, just as it is called in bodies heat, coldness, dryness, and wetness. Just as it is called in the elements (الأركان) fire, air, water, and earth. Just as it is called in the animal black bile, yellow bile, phlegm, and blood. The Essence (العين) is one, but the ruling is different.

The Essence (العين) is one, but the ruling is different;
And that is a secret unveiled to the people of Knowledge.

Then the Intellect turned its face toward the Cloud (العماء). It saw that the part of it where no form had appeared remained. It saw that the part where forms had appeared was illuminated by the forms. It saw what remained without form as pure darkness (ظلمة خالصة). It saw that it was receptive to forms and illumination. Know that this only occurs by its joining with your shadow. The Divine Self-disclosure encompassed it, just as the pleasure of intercourse encompasses the soul of the one having intercourse until it is absent from every intelligible and known thing except its own essence. When the light of the Self-disclosure encompassed it, its shadow returned to it and united with it. This was a spiritual marriage (نكاحا معنويا) from which issued the Throne (العرش) upon which the Real mentioned that the Name *al-Rahman* established Himself. He said: <<The Merciful (الرَّحْمنُ) established Himself upon the Throne (عَلَى الْعَرْشِ اسْتَوى‏)>>.

Those who denied Him—meaning the Name *al-Rahman*—did so only because of the excessive proximity (للقرب المفرط). They only affirmed Allah because of what this Name implies of Mercy and Power. They knew and yet were ignorant of *al-Rahman*, so they said: <<And what is *al-Rahman* (وما الرَّحْمنُ)?>> If they had said it in a non-Arabic tongue, they would have said something similar to this meaning, and the denial would still occur from them. Nothing is closer to creation than Mercy, because nothing is closer to them than their own existence, and their existence is undoubtedly Mercy.

### Section Two: On the Form of the Throne, the Footstool, the Two Feet, and the Water upon which the Throne rests, the Air upon which the Water rests, and the Darkness from which the Air appeared, which holds the Water and holds upon it the current, the bearers, and the surrounding angels.

### [The Darkness of the Unseen]

Know that this Darkness is the Darkness of the Unseen (الغيب). That is why it is called darkness—meaning what is within it does not appear. Everything that emerges from the Unseen appears to us. We look at what has appeared of the forms of the Cosmos in the mirror of the Unseen (مرآة الغيب), and we do not know that this is in the mirror of the Unseen. It is like a mirror for the Real. When the Real discloses Himself to it, what is in the Divine Knowledge of the forms and fixed entities of the Cosmos is imprinted upon it. The Real has never ceased disclosing Himself to it, so the forms of the Cosmos have never ceased being in the Unseen. Everything that appeared to those who exist in the Cosmos is only what is reflected to them in their gaze into this mirror, which is the Unseen.

Among what he saw in it was the form of the Throne (العرش) upon which *al-Rahman* established Himself. It is a couch (سرير) with four pillars (أركان أربعة) and four faces, which are its original legs. If one were to face them, the Throne would be stable upon them. However, on every one of the four faces, it has many legs, equal in number, known to us, exceeding the four main pillars. He made it hollow, encompassing everything it contains: the Footstool (كرسي), the spheres (أفلاك), the Gardens (جنات), the heavens (سموات), the elements (أركان), and the generated things (مولدات). When He brought it into existence, *al-Rahman* established Himself upon it, a singular Word (الكلمة الواحدة) with no opposite. Thus, it is entirely Mercy (رحمة كله); there is nothing in it that opposes Mercy.

It is a form in the Cloud (العماء). The Intellect (العقل) is its father, and the Soul (النفس) is its mother. That is why *al-Rahman* established Himself upon it, for the two parents never look upon their child except with Mercy, and Allah is the Most Merciful of the Merciful. The Soul and the Intellect are existent, noble to Allah, and beloved by Allah. He only established Himself upon the Throne with that which comforts the eyes of the two parents, which is *al-Rahman*. We know that nothing issues from Him except what contains Mercy. Even if some affliction (غصص) befalls some of the Cosmos, that is due to a Mercy within it. Were it not for that, what He made them swallow would necessitate the temperament of nature and the opposition of the psychic purpose. It is like a medicine that is bitter-tasting and unpleasant, yet contains mercy for the one who drinks and uses it, even if he dislikes it. <<Its inner dimension contains Mercy, and its outer dimension, from its direction, contains punishment (باطِنُهُ فِيهِ الرَّحْمَةُ وظاهِرُهُ من قِبَلِهِ الْعَذابُ)>>.

*Al-Rahman*, the Exalted, only established Himself upon it after He created the Earth and <<measured therein its provisions (قَدَّرَ فِيها أَقْواتَها)>>, and created the heavens and <<revealed in every heaven its command (أَوْحى‏ في كُلِّ سَماءٍ أَمْرَها)>>. He finished the creation of all these matters and arranged the elements (الأركان) in an order that accepts transformations for the manifestation of formation (التكوين) and transition from state to state. After this, <<He established Himself upon the Throne (اسْتَوى‏ عَلَى الْعَرْشِ)>>. Allah Almighty said: <<So ask about it (به) an expert (فَسْئَلْ به خَبِيراً)>>. The pronoun in *bihi* (about it) refers to the Establishment (الاستواء)—meaning, ask about the Establishment an expert. This means everyone who attained that through direct experience (ذوقا), like us, for the people of Allah only knew what they knew through direct experience, not through reflection or deliberation. He, the Exalted, is the Descender (النازل) who does not separate from the place of descent or the descent itself. He is with everything according to the state of that thing.

On the night I was writing this section, the Real showed me in my vision a man of medium height with a reddish complexion. He sat before me silently. The Real said to me: "This is one of Our servants; benefit him so that this may be in your balance." I asked Him: "My Lord, how can he benefit from me, and where am I from him?" He said to me: "Speak, for he will benefit from you. Just as I showed him to you, I showed you to him. He sees you now as you see him. Address him, and he will hear from you." He says something like what you say: "I was shown a man in Damascus called Muhammad ibn al-Arabi, and he named me. He benefited me with a matter I did not possess. He is my master."

I said to him: "O Abu al-Abbas, what is the matter?" He said: "I used to strive in seeking and exert myself and spend my effort. When unveiling (كشف) occurred to me, I knew that I was the one sought (مطلوب), so I rested from that toil." I said to him: "O my brother, whoever was better than you, closer to the Real, more complete in witnessing, and clearer in the matter, was told: <<Say: My Lord, increase me in knowledge (وقل رب زدني علما)>>. Where is rest in the abode of responsibility (دار التكليف)? You did not understand what was said to you. Your saying, 'I knew that I was the one sought,' and you did not know by what you were blessed. You are sought by the striving and diligence you were upon. This abode is not an abode of rest. When you finish a matter you are engaged in, exert yourself in a matter that comes to you in every breath. Where is the leisure?" He thanked me for what I reminded him of. Look at Allah's care for us and for him.

We return and say: Then He, the Exalted, created angels from the lights of the Throne who surround the Throne. Among the angels He created, He made four bearers (حملة) who carry the Throne from the four pillars upon which the Throne rests. Each pillar is shared between every two faces, up to the limit of every half-face. He made its pillars unequal in rank. He placed me in the most excellent of them and made me one of its bearers. Although Allah created angels to carry the Throne, He also has forms from the human species (الصنف الإنساني) who carry the Throne upon which *al-Rahman* is established, and I am one of them.

The pillar that is the most excellent of its pillars belongs to us, and it is the treasury of Mercy (خزانة الرحمة). He made me absolutely merciful (رحيما مطلقا), despite my knowledge of severities (الشدائد). But I knew that there is no severity except that it contains ease, no punishment except that it contains mercy, no contraction except that it contains expansion, and no narrowness except that it contains spaciousness. Thus, I knew both matters. The pillar on my right is also a pillar of Mercy, but it lacks the knowledge of severity, so its bearer is lower in degree than the bearer of the Greatest Pillar, which is the most comprehensive of the pillars. The pillar on my left is the pillar of Severity and Compulsion (الشدة والقهر), and its bearer knows nothing else. The fourth pillar, which faces me, received an overflow from the pillar I am on, so it appeared in its form. It is light and darkness, and in it is mercy and severity.

On the half of every face is a pillar, making eight pillars. Four of these have no bearers today until the Day of Resurrection. On the Day of Resurrection, Allah will assign those who will carry them, so they will be eight in the Hereafter, while they are four in the world. Between every two pillars are the pillars of the Throne upon which its adornment rests. Their number is known to us, but I will not disclose it, lest limited understandings rush to imagine that those pillars are the very thing they imagined, which is not the case. Therefore, we have not clarified their quantity.

Between the concave surface of the Throne and the Footstool (الكرسي) is a vast space (فضاء واسع) and burning air. The forms of the deeds of some of the saints (الأولياء) among the children of Adam fly from place to place in that Merciful expanse. The pillars of this Throne rest upon frozen Water (الماء الجامد). That is why coldness is attributed to Mercy, as the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "I found the coldness of his fingertips." He gave him the knowledge that contains Mercy.

The Throne is carried only by the frozen Water. The bearers (الحملة) are only serving it out of veneration and glorification. That frozen Water rests upon cold Air (الهواء البارد), which is what froze the Water. That Air is the very breath of the Darkness (الظلمة), which is the Unseen (الغيب). No one knows what that Darkness is except Allah, as He said: <<Knower of the Unseen, and He does not disclose His Unseen to anyone (عالِمُ الْغَيْبِ فَلا يُظْهِرُ عَلى‏ غَيْبِهِ أَحَداً)>>.

It is in this Darkness that people will be upon the Bridge (الجسر) when the Earth is changed to other than the Earth. The change is in the attribute, not in the fixed entity (العين). It will be an Earth of righteousness, not an Earth of corruption. It will be stretched out like a hide, so <<you will see no crookedness or unevenness therein (لا تَرى‏ فِيها عِوَجاً ولا أَمْتاً)>>. This will be mentioned in its section in these chapters, if Allah wills.

He created the Footstool (الكرسي) inside the hollow of this Throne, square in shape. He let down the Two Feet (القدمين) to it. The singular Word (الكلمة الواحدة) that is singular in the Throne was divided. In the Throne, it is a singular Mercy (رحمة واحدة) toward which everything inclines. In the Footstool, it was divided into Mercy and Wrath (غضب) mixed with Mercy. This composition necessitated what Allah willed to manifest in the Cosmos of contraction (القبض) and expansion (البسط) and all opposites. For He is the Giver of Honor, the Humiliator, the Contractor, the Expander, the Giver, the Withholder. Allah Almighty said: <<Is he upon whom the word of punishment has been justly decreed (أَ فَمَنْ حَقَّ عَلَيْهِ كَلِمَةُ الْعَذابِ)?>> This is from the division of the Word. However, if the matter is essential (ذاتيا), it can only be this way.

Look at the Cosmos in its details, a wonder;
And the return of all in the Hereafter is to Allah.

In the Origin, it is agreed; in the forms, it is diverse;
World and Hereafter, so the Judgment belongs to Allah.

In Allah, from His being a manifestation (مجلى) for His Cosmos;
And the Cosmos is not seen except as Allah, by Allah.

Know your existence (وجودك) that Generosity (الجود) is existence-giving (موجدة);
And be, by that, upon knowledge from Allah.

Just as the All-Merciful established Himself upon the Throne (العرش), the Two Feet were established upon the Footstool (الكرسي). The Footstool is similar in shape to the Throne in its squareness, but not in its supports. It is in relation to the Throne like a ring cast in a vast desert. Thus, the Footstool is the place of rest for the Establishment (الاستواء). For nothing descended toward it except through expansion, and the Foot signifies fixity (الثبوت). Those are the Foot of Truth (قدم الصدق), the Foot of the Compeller (قدم الجبار), the Foot of Compulsion (قدم الجبر), and the Foot of Choice (قدم الاختيار). These two Feet have many levels (مراتب كثيرة) in Divine Knowledge (العلم الإلهي), which time does not permit us to detail, due to our commitment to brevity and conciseness in this book. The foundation of this Footstool is also upon solidified water. Within the hollow of this Footstool are all created things, including the heavens and the elements (أركان), which are contained within it just as it is contained within the Throne. It has angels who are the Dividers (المقسمات). This is why the Word (الكلمة) became divided within it, because this class [of angels] does not recognize Oneness (أحدية), even though Oneness is present in them. For Allah has entrusted them with division (التقسيم) alongside the breaths (الأنفاس). If He were to grant them the witnessing (الشهود) of Oneness—both in themselves and in all things—they might be distracted by it for a single breath from the division for which they were created. They are the obedient ones, as Allah informed us about them. Thus, a barrier was placed between them and the witnessing of Unities (الوحدات). Any sign of Unity (وحدة) that manifests to them, they divide according to the ruling (بالحكم). Therefore, they witness nothing but division (القسمة) in everything, and they possess neither heedlessness (غفلة) nor forgetfulness regarding what they know. As for the angels of Unification (التوحيد) and Unities, if a Divine assembly gathers them with the Dividers and negotiations occur between them concerning the matter, they dispute, because they are opposites. This is part of what the Highest Assembly (الملأ الأعلى) disputes over. One class affirms Unity (الوحدة), and the other affirms division (الانقسام). The dualistic spirits (الثنوية) were only brought into existence from these spirits, and these spirits were only brought into existence from the two forces within the Universal Soul (النفس الكلية).

> The Soul is known only through Him,
> And The Real (الحق) is known only through it.

> So be for Him a transcender (منزها) of His Essence (ذاته),
> And be for Him a likener (مشبها) through His Soul (نفسه).
> And whoever adheres to what I have enjoined upon him,
> Will be attentive to what I have commanded.

Know—may Allah grant you knowledge—that the divinity (ألوهية) of created beings appeared in the World (العالم) from this Presence (حضرة) due to the division of everything that it grants. Nothing appeared in the World except what the Exalted created within it and knew. The scholars of Allah (العلماء بالله) were distinguished and gained superiority (الشفوف) over others only by knowing the sources of things—from where they appeared in the World. We do not doubt that opposition (التقابل) is a division within something divided, so there must be a comprehensive entity (عين جامعة) that accepts division. Since the excuse of the World is acceptable in reality, due to their being compelled (مجبورين) in their choice, Allah made the ultimate destiny of all to be Mercy. He is the Forgiving (الغفور) for what He concealed of this from the hearts of those who did not know the reality of the matter, out of mercy for them, because He is the Merciful (الرحيم) in His forgiveness, knowing that their temperament (مزاج) would not accept it. The withholding comes from the recipient, because it contains the Divine Will (مشيئة الحق), since the entity (العين) is receptive to every temperament. No single entity was specifically designated with one temperament over another, despite its capacity to receive every temperament, except by the ruling of the Divine Will (المشيئة الإلهية). And to this [level], when the spirits of duality ascend, their ascension (معراج) is confined, having no footing elsewhere. They have a specific path, and <<وَعَلَى اللهِ قَصْدُ السَّبِيلِ>> (And upon Allah is the direction of the path).

### Chapter Three: Concerning the Unstarred Sphere (الفلك الأطلس), the Constellations (البروج), the Gardens (الجنات), the Tuba Tree (شجرة طوبى), and the Surface of the Starred Sphere (الفلك المكوكب).

Know that Allah created within the hollow of this Footstool (الكرسي) we mentioned a transparent, spherical body, which He divided into twelve sections. He named these sections constellations (بروج), and these are what He swore by for us in His Book, saying, <<وَالسَّمَاءِ ذَاتِ الْبُرُوجِ>> (By the heaven containing the constellations). He settled an angel in each constellation. These angels are to the people of the Garden (أهل الجنة) what the elements (العناصر) are to the people of the World (أهل الدنيا). They are divided into watery, earthy, airy, and fiery. Through these [angels], whatever is formed in the Gardens is formed, whatever is transformed is transformed, and whatever is corrupted is corrupted—meaning, it is corrupted by changing its order into another state, not the blameworthy, vile corruption. This is the meaning of "it is corrupted," so do not misunderstand. From this [concept], the Imamiyya (Twelver Shi'a) derived their doctrine of the Twelve Imams, for these angels are the Imams (أئمة) of the World (العالم) under their encompassment. Because these twelve do not change their stations, the Imamiyya asserted the infallibility (عصمة) of the Imams, though they are unaware that the spiritual sustenance (الإمداد) comes to them from this place. When their spirits are blessed and travel joyfully in these ascensions (معارج) after the decisive judgment (الفصل والقضاء النافذ), they terminate at this Sphere (فلك) and do not pass beyond it, for they believed in nothing else.

Although they are twelve, they are arranged in four levels (مراتب), because the Throne (العرش) rests on four supports. The stations (منازل) are three: the World (دنيا), the Isthmus (برزخ), and the Hereafter (آخرة); there is no fourth. For each of these stations, there are four indispensable [rulers] who hold authority over the inhabitants of those stations. If you multiply three by four, the result is twelve. Therefore, there are twelve constellations (برجا). Since the Abode of the World (الدار الدنيا) returns as Fire in the Hereafter, the ruling of the four that belong to it remains upon it. The Isthmus is in the marketplace of the Garden, and the ruling of the four is indispensable there. The Garden also requires the ruling of the four. Thus, the constellations are indispensable. Aries, Leo, and Sagittarius are on one level of the four in their temperament (مزاج). Taurus, Virgo, and Capricorn are on another level, also as governors (ولاة). Gemini, Libra, and Aquarius are on another level, also as governors. Cancer, Scorpio, and Pisces are on another level, also as governors. This is because each of the three in a group shares a single nature in their temperament, but the stations of their rulings are three, and they are four governors in each station. Each one of them holds authority in every one of the three stations, just as the day and night belong to one of the seven wandering, hiding, sweeping planets (السبع الجواري الخنس الكنس)—it is its governor and master, the ruler therein. However, the rest of the planets also have a ruling within it alongside the master of the day. He does not rule independently of the group except during the first hour of his day and the eighth hour. The night and the Hereafter are similar. Even if the Hereafter has Leo, just as the World had Cancer, the rest of the constellations must have a ruling within it. Likewise, even if the Isthmus has Virgo, every one of the remaining [constellations] must have a ruling within it. There is no third station except through the transformation of the World into Fire. By the original ruling, the master of the World was Cancer. When it returned as Fire, Cancer was deposed, and the constellation Libra became its governor, followed by the rest [of the constellations] in authority. Observe how wondrous this is! When the torment of the people of the Fire ceases, the constellation Gemini governs it, and the remaining constellations must have a ruling in the governance of this governor. When the ruling belongs to one of these [governors] during the time of his supervision over them, the temperament of the recipient in the Hereafter will be according to the ruling of the opposite, so that he may enjoy it when this [governor] rules over him, especially in the final outcome (المال), because the final outcome is absolute and universal Mercy. <<فَبِذَلِكَ فَلْيَفْرَحُوا>> (So in that let them rejoice)—I mean, <<بِفَضْلِ اللهِ وَبِرَحْمَتِهِ فَإِنَّهُ خَيْرٌ مِمَّا يَجْمَعُونَ>> (in the Bounty of Allah and in His Mercy—in that let them rejoice; it is better than what they accumulate).

When Allah caused the Unstarred Sphere (الفلك الأطلس) to revolve, with the governors and rulers He placed within it, and made the completion of its revolution a full day—in which there is neither night nor day—He brought into existence what is within it upon its movement, and through what He cast and revealed to the deputies (النواب) concerning the ruling therein. He appointed for their rulings a known, limited duration in every entity (عين). These durations vary according to the worldly, otherworldly, and isthmus stations. The ruling of the Isthmus (البرزخى) is the shortest in duration and the most frequent in ruling. Its years are according to its days, and the days are of varying lengths: a day of half a revolution, a day of a full revolution, a day of twenty-eight revolutions, and more than that, up to the Day of Ascensions (يوم المعارج), and less than that, down to the Day of Divine Affairs (يوم الشئون). Between these two days are varying degrees of days. He appointed for each deputy among these twelve angels, in every constellation he governs, thirty treasuries (خزانة). Each treasury contains various sciences (علوم شتى). They bestow from these upon whoever descends to them, according to the rank (رتبة) granted to that descender. These are the treasuries of which Allah said, <<وَإِنْ مِنْ شَيْءٍ إِلَّا عِنْدَنَا خَزَائِنُهُ وَمَا نُنَزِّلُهُ إِلَّا بِقَدَرٍ مَعْلُومٍ>> (And there is nothing but that with Us are its treasuries, and We do not send it down except in a known measure). This descender to them does not expend the sciences he obtained from these treasuries upon himself, for his share of them is merely the attainment of them. Rather, he expends what he obtained in the world of the elements (الأركان), the generated beings (المولدات), and the human being (الإنسان). Among the descenders, some stay with them for one day in each treasury and then depart; this is the shortest stay for a descender. The longest stay for a descender is one who remains at each treasury for one hundred years to obtain from it according to his rank with Allah and what his preparedness (استعداده) grants him. The rest of the descenders stay between one hundred years and one day. I mean by "a day," the duration of the movement of this Unstarred Sphere (الفلك الأطلس), and by "one hundred years," three hundred and sixty days of this movement for every year. Understand this.

These treasuries are called the degrees of the Sphere (درجات الفلك) by the people of teachings. Those who descend to them are the wandering planets (الجواري), the lunar mansions (المنازل), and their fixed stars (الثوابت). The sciences obtained from these Divine treasuries are the influences (التأثيرات) that appear in the world of the elements (عالم الأركان), indeed, everything that appears from the concave surface of the Sphere of Fixed Stars down to the Earth. They were named fixed (ثابتة) due to their slowness compared to the speed of the seven wandering planets. He granted these twelve [angels] direct supervision (نظرا) over the Gardens (الجنات), their inhabitants, and everything within them, without any veil (حجاب). Thus, any ruling that appears in the Gardens is due to the direct administration of these twelve by their very selves, as an honor to the people of the Garden. As for the people of the World and the people of the Fire, the rulings concerning them are administered only through deputies (النواب), who are the descenders we mentioned. Everything that appears in the Gardens—formation, eating, drinking, marriage, movement, stillness, sciences, transformation, food, and desire—is through the hands of these twelve deputies, drawing from those treasuries, by the permission of Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, who appointed them as vicegerents. For this reason, there is a great difference (بون عظيم) and a major distinction (فرقان كبير) between what results from their direct administration and what results from them indirectly, through the mediation of the descenders, who act as veils (الحجاب) and deputies (النواب) for them in the World and the Fire. The knowledge of this distinction (الفرقان) is attained in the World by whoever fears Allah, which is His saying concerning this and similar matters: <<إِنْ تَتَّقُوا اللهَ يَجْعَلْ لَكُمْ فُرْقَانًا>> (If you fear Allah, He will grant you a Criterion [Furqan]), which is the knowledge of this and similar things. And <<وَيُكَفِّرْ عَنْكُمْ سَيِّئَاتِكُمْ>> (And He will remove from you your misdeeds)—meaning, He will conceal from you what displeases you, so that no pain reaches you from witnessing it. For the sight of evil, when seen by one who could potentially be its locus, even if it does not befall him, displeases him due to the ruling of the imagination (الوهم) he possesses and the rational possibility (الإمكان العقلي). And <<وَيَغْفِرْ لَكُمْ>> (And He will forgive you)—meaning, He will conceal, for your sake, from those for whom you have concern, whether in a general or specific supplication. The specific supplication is when you designate a particular person or type, and the general is what you send forth universally upon Allah's servants who might be afflicted by evil. And Allah is <<ذُو الْفَضْلِ الْعَظِيمِ>> (Possessor of Great Bounty), due to the Mercy He has made incumbent upon Himself and the favor He grants from it to those who deserve punishment, such as the disobedient in fundamental and subsidiary matters.

These twelve deputies are the ones who undertook the construction of all the Gardens (الجنات), except for the Garden of Eden (جنة عدن). Allah created Eden with His Hand and made it for Himself, like a fortress for a king. He placed within it the white dune of musk (الكثيب الأبيض من المسك), which is the manifestation of the Form in which the Lord (الرب) discloses Himself (يتجلى) to His servants during the Vision (الرؤية)—like the *misk* (skin/hide) of the animal, which is the skin, the outer covering visible to the eyes of the animal. He placed the planting of the Gardens in their hands, except for the Tuba Tree (شجرة طوبى). The Exalted Real (الحق تعالى) planted it with His Hand in the Garden of Eden and extended it until its branches rose above the wall of the Garden of Eden and hung down, overlooking all the other Gardens. There is no fruit in its sheaths except jewelry (الحلي) and garments (الحلل)—the clothing and adornment of the people of the Garden—surpassing in beauty and splendor what the sheaths of the other trees of the Gardens bear, because the Tuba Tree has a special distinction of merit due to Allah having created it with His Hand. The clothing of the people of the Garden is not woven fabric; rather, the fruit of the Garden splits open to reveal their clothing, just as sheaths here split open to reveal roses, anemones, and all similar flowers. As reported in the sound tradition, through unveiling (كشفا) and the fair tradition (حسن نقلا), the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, was addressing the people when a man entered and said—or a man stood up from those present, the doubt is mine—"O Messenger of Allah, are the clothes of the people of the Garden created or are they woven?" Those present laughed at his words. The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, disliked this from them and said, "Do you laugh because an ignorant person asked a knowledgeable one? O man," and he pointed to the questioner, "rather, the fruit of the Garden splits open to reveal them." Thus, they gained knowledge they had not known before.

He surrounded the Garden of Eden with the rest of the Gardens, and between every Garden and another is a wall distinguishing it from its neighbor. Each Garden was named with a name whose meaning permeates every Garden, even if that Garden is specifically designated by that name, because the name by which it is designated is the most perfect and excellent expression of its meaning. This is like his saying, peace and blessings be upon him, "The best of you in judgment is Ali, the most knowledgeable of you concerning the lawful and the unlawful is Mu'adh ibn Jabal, and the best of you in prescribed shares (فرائض) is Zayd," even though each of them knew judgment, the lawful and the unlawful, and the prescribed shares, but the one named by it is the most specific to it. These are the Garden of Eden (جنة عدن), the Garden of Paradise (جنة الفردوس), the Garden of Delight (جنة النعيم), the Garden of Refuge (جنة المأوى), the Garden of Eternity (جنة الخلد), the Garden of Peace (جنة السلام), the Garden of Abode (جنة المقامة), and the *Wasila* (الوسيلة), which is the highest Garden among the Gardens. It exists in every Garden, from the Garden of Eden to the last Garden, having a form in each Garden. It is specific to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, alone, which he attained through the supplication of his community—a wisdom from Allah, since people attained happiness through the blessing of his mission and his calling them to Allah, and his clarification of the rulings Allah sent down to mankind, <<جَزَاءً وِفَاقًا>> (A fitting recompense). He made the ground of these Gardens the surface of the Starred Sphere (الفلك المكوكب), which is the roof of the Fire. Its chapter will come later in these chapters, if Allah wills. He placed in every Garden one hundred degrees (درجة), corresponding to the number of the Beautiful Names (الأسماء الحسنى) and the Greatest Name (الاسم الأعظم) that is kept silent, due to the oddness (وترية) of the Names. This Name, by which The Real (الحق) is distinguished from the World (العالم), specifically supervises the degree of the *Wasila*. It has a ruling in every Garden, just as it has the ruling of a Divine Name. Understand this.

### [The Stations of the Garden are according to the number of the verses of the Quran]

The stations of the Garden correspond to the number of verses (آي) of the Quran. Those verses that reached us, we attained that station through recitation; those that did not reach us, we attained through specialization in the Gardens of Specialization, just as we inherited the Gardens of the people of the Fire who are its inhabitants. The gates of the Garden are eight, corresponding to the number of the limbs of responsibility (أعضاء التكليف). For this reason, it is reported in the tradition that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said concerning one who performs ablution, prays two cycles, and does not speak to himself about anything, "The eight gates of the Garden will be opened for him, and he may enter through whichever he wishes." Abu Bakr al-Siddiq, may Allah be pleased with him, said to him, "What if he were to enter through all of its gates?" The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, confirmed and affirmed the statement of Abu Bakr. In one tradition, the master of this spiritual state (الحال) made a gate for every limb. The limbs are eight: the eye, the ear, the tongue, the hand, the stomach, the private parts, the leg, and the heart. A human being may perform the actions of all these limbs simultaneously, thus entering through the eight gates of the Garden while entering through every single gate, because the existence of the Hereafter (نشأة الآخرة) resembles the Isthmus (البرزخ) and the inner being of the human insofar as he possesses imagination (خيال).

As for the small windows (خوخات) of the Gardens, they are seventy-nine windows, corresponding to the branches of faith (شعب الايمان), which are seventy-odd branches. The *bid'* (odd number) here is nine, for *bid'* in language ranges from one to nine. The lowest branch of faith is the removal of harm from the road, and the highest is *La ilaha illa Allah* (There is no god but Allah). Between them are the related deeds and noble character traits (مكارم الأخلاق). Whoever performs any noble character trait is upon a branch of faith, even if he is not a believer, like one who receives revelation in the form of glad tidings (المبشرات), which is a part of prophecy (النبوة), even if the recipient of the glad tidings is not a prophet. Be attentive to the universality of Allah's Mercy. Prophecy is only applied to one who is characterized by the totality [of these branches]. That is the Prophet, and that is the prophecy that was veiled from us and ceased, for part of it is legislation (التشريع) through angelic revelation concerning law, and that belongs exclusively to a prophet. Therefore, this branch must have a ruling concerning the one who possesses it, is characterized by it, and upon whom its effect appears. When Allah informed us of this branch through the tongue of the Messenger, He attributed it to faith (الايمان) in an absolute sense; He did not restrict faith to such-and-such, but said "Faith." And faith in such-and-such is a branch of absolute faith. Every branch is faith, such as those who believe specifically in falsehood (الباطل)—which is reconciling people through what was not true, and deception in war. Thus, lying has an entry into faith; in that context, it is a branch of faith. This may be found in the believer and the non-believer, given that there is no such thing as a non-believer, for Allah has not abandoned him, just as there is no such thing as a non-disbeliever. The matter is confined between one who believes in Allah, one who believes in falsehood, one who disbelieves in Allah, and one who disbelieves in falsehood. Every servant of Allah is simultaneously a believer and a disbeliever; what defines his belief and disbelief is what he is restricted by.

For every branch of faith, there is a path to the Garden. The people of the Gardens are in every Garden, and the people of the Fire, insofar as they possessed branches of faith—and these are the people of the Fire who will not leave it—will have, due to the branches of faith they possessed, all the meanings of the Gardens within the Fire, except for the Garden of Paradise (جنة الفردوس) and the *Wasila* (الوسيلة); they have no footing in those two, for Paradise has no corresponding entity (عين) in the Fire. Thus, they will have Delight (النعيم), Eternity (الخلد), Refuge (المأوى), Peace (السلام), Abode (المقامة), and Eden (عدن). The people of the Gardens will have the Vision (الرؤية) whenever they wish, and the people of the Fire will have the Vision at specific times. For Allah did not impose the veil (الحجاب) upon them absolutely. Rather, He said "on that Day" in His statement: <<كَلَّا إِنَّهُمْ عَنْ رَبِّهِمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ لَمَحْجُوبُونَ>> (Nay! Indeed, from their Lord, on that Day, they will be veiled), when He returned to them and intensified [the ruling] in the state of Wrath.
