Lordship (الربوبية) entails compassion, for the one being nurtured is weak and must be treated gently. Therefore, in the state of Wrath, he was veiled from his Lord. Understand this. That veiling resulted in Him making him enter the Blazing Fire (الجحيم), because He said after His statement, <<لَمَحْجُوبُونَ>> (they will be veiled), <<ثُمَّ إِنَّهُمْ لَصَالُوا الْجَحِيمِ>> (Then indeed, they will enter the Blazing Fire). He used the word *thumma* (then), indicating that they only enter the Blazing Fire after the veiling occurs. That is why He restricted it with "on that Day."

Likewise, no human being or responsible person (مكلف) is devoid of possessing one of the character traits (أخلاق) of Allah. Allah has three hundred character traits. Therefore, every human, whether believer or disbeliever, must possess one of Allah's character traits, and all of Allah's character traits are good and praiseworthy. Every essence (ذات) that possesses one of these traits and directs it to the place that trait deserves must be made happy by it, whether they are in the Fire or the Gardens, for there is a reward (أجر) in every moist liver. Every human must show compassion for some matter related to Allah's creation, and thus receives a reward for that. The lowest levels (دركات) of the Fire are the levels where the torment has not ceased. When the torment reaches its appointed term, that lowest level reverts, for the one residing in it, to a degree (درجة) corresponding to the Divine character trait he once possessed.

> Allah is too Generous for His favor to forget you,
> And He is of the most Bountiful, even if the All-Merciful does not bestow.

When the Exalted Allah placed intellect ('aql) in the responsible person (المكلف) and disclosed Himself (تجلى) to him, the person, through his intellect and contemplation, established a covenant ('aqd) and a pledge ('ahd) with Allah. That rational contemplation obligated him to this, which is essential neediness (الافتقار) toward Allah and similar matters. Then He sent a Messenger from Himself, who took another pledge upon him, based on what was established in the first covenant (الميثاق الأول). Thus, the human being stands with Allah between two pledges: a rational pledge (عهد عقلي) and a legal pledge (عهد شرعي). Allah commanded him to fulfill both, indeed, the spiritual state (الحال) demanded this of him due to his acceptance. When I stood upon these two pledges, and my knowledge of them reached the level attained by one who witnesses them, I said:

> In the heart is the covenant of intellect and the covenant of guidance.
> Do you think one who has two covenants can be saved?

> My Lord, by what You granted me, I knew it.
> Why do You see me failing in what You burdened me with?

> Not everything You tasked me with can I bear.
> Who will help me achieve salvation and these two?

> Intellect and Law call my heart to fulfillment,
> But I have no hands for fulfillment.

> If You are my attribute, then fulfillment is achieved.
> Or if You are You, then they do not concern me.

As for my saying, "If You are my attribute," this refers to the saying of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, reporting from his Lord, who said, "I was his hearing, his sight, his hand, and his supporter." Likewise, if I mean by "You are You," that You are the Doer and the Originator of the action and the fulfillment, not me, since in our covenant (عقدنا) there is no origination (إيجاد) for a creature, but rather the command belongs entirely to Allah. Thus, the two (meaning the Intellect and the Law) do not concern me by their ruling. Rather, they concern the one who has the creation of deeds, states, and the power over them. We only stated this to confirm for the listeners the truth of Allah's saying, <<وَكَانَ الْإِنْسَانُ أَكْثَرَ شَيْءٍ جَدَلًا>> (And man is the most disputing of creatures). The strongest dispute is that by which Allah is disputed.

### [That the Tuba Tree is to all the trees of the Gardens as Adam is to the children who appeared from him]

Know that the Tuba Tree (شجرة طوبى) is to all the trees of the Gardens (الجنات) as Adam is to the children who appeared from him. When Allah planted it with His Hand and fashioned it, He breathed into it of His Spirit (روحه), just as He did with Mary, breathing into her of His Spirit, resulting in Jesus, who revived the dead and healed the blind and the leper. Adam was honored by the Two Hands and the breathing of the Spirit into him. The breathing of the Spirit into him bequeathed him the knowledge of the Names (علم الأسماء), due to his being created by the Two Hands. By this totality, he attained the Command and was granted the Vicegerency (الخلافة). And <<الْمَالُ وَالْبَنُونَ زِينَةُ الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا>> (Wealth and children are the adornment of the worldly life). The Real (الحق) undertook the planting of the Tuba Tree with His Hand and breathed the Spirit into it, adorning it with the fruit of jewelry and garments, which are adornments for those who wear them. We are its earth, for Allah made <<مَا عَلَى الْأَرْضِ زِينَةً لَهَا>> (what is on the earth an adornment for it). It gave forth, in all the fruit of the Garden, the very reality of what it is, just as the date stone gives forth the palm tree and what it bears, along with the stone within its fruit. Everyone whom The Real undertakes directly, from His specific aspect, concerning any matter, possesses superiority (شفوفا) and distinction over one who does not have this specialization or this direct attention. And <<وَاللهُ يَقُولُ الْحَقَّ وَهُوَ يَهْدِي السَّبِيلَ>> (And Allah speaks the Truth, and He guides to the way).

### Chapter Four: Concerning the Sphere of the Lunar Mansions (فلك المنازل)

This is the Starred Sphere (المكوكب), the structure of the heavens and the earth, the elements (الأركان), the generated beings (المولدات), and the pillars (العمد) by which Allah holds the heaven from falling upon the earth, out of His Mercy for the people within it, despite their disbelief in His favor. The heaven will not fall, collapsing and weak, until the people are removed from it.

### [That Allah created the Starred Sphere within the hollow of the Unstarred Sphere]

Know that Allah created this Starred Sphere (الفلك المكوكب) within the hollow of the Unstarred Sphere (الفلك الأطلس). Between the two, He created the Gardens (الجنات) with everything in them. Thus, the Starred Sphere is their earth, and the Unstarred Sphere is their heaven. Between them is a space whose limit is known only to those whom Allah informs. The Starred Sphere is within the Unstarred Sphere like a ring in a vast desert. Within the concave surface of this Sphere are twenty-eight lunar mansions (منزلة), along with what He added to these stars, which are called the mansions of the wandering planets (القطع السيارة) within it. There is no difference between them and the rest of the stars that are not mansions, neither in their movement nor in the specific rulings concerning their descent, which we mentioned regarding the constellations (البروج). The Exalted said, <<وَالْقَمَرَ قَدَّرْنَاهُ مَنَازِلَ>> (And the moon, We have decreed for it stations [manazil]), meaning these specific mansions in this Starred Sphere. They are like a belt among the stars, from *al-Sharatayn* (The Two Signs) to *al-Risha* (The Rope). These are estimations and assumptions within this body, and the specific entities (أعيان) of these measures are known only through these stars, just as they were only known to be mansions by the descent of the wandering planets into them. Were it not for that, they would not be distinguished from the rest of the stars except by their individual forms.

From the concave surface of this Sphere downward is the Abode of the World (الدار الدنيا). From there downward, whatever you see undergoes transformation into the Hereafter (الأخرى). The Hereafter has a form within it that is different from the form of the World. Those who transition from it to the Garden (جنة) transition, whether human or non-human, and those who remain in it remain, whether human or non-human. Everyone who remains in it is among the people of the Fire who are its inhabitants. Allah appointed for every star among these stars sections in the Unstarred Sphere, so that they may obtain from those treasuries in its constellations, and through the hands of its twelve angels, the sciences of influence (علوم التأثير) that the reality of each star grants. We have already explained this. He made them of different natures. The light in them and in the rest of the wandering planets (السيارة) comes from the light of the Sun, which is the Greatest, Cardiac Star (الكوكب الأعظم القلبي). The light of the Sun does not originate from its own entity (عينها), but rather from a perpetual Theophany (تجل) to it from His Name, The Light (النور). Thus, there is no light except the Light of Allah, who is the Light of the heavens and the earth. People attribute that light to the body of the Sun. There is no difference between the Sun and the stars in this regard, except that the Theophany to the Sun is continuous. Therefore, its light does not depart until the time of its folding up (تكويرها). That exemplary, luminous Theophany is concealed from the eyes of the beholders by the veil (الحجاب) between it and their eyes.

By the swimming of these stars, spheres (أفلاكا)—meaning paths—are created in this Sphere. The air encompasses all created things; it is the life of the World (العالم). It is hot and moist. What is excessive in heat and warmth is called Fire (نارا). What is excessive in moisture and low in heat is called Water (ماء). What remains in a state of equilibrium retains the name Air (الهواء). Upon the Air, the Water is held, and by it, Water flows, streams, and moves. Among the elements (الأركان), nothing is more receptive to rapid transformation (الاستحالة) than Air, because it is the origin, being a derivative of the conjunction of heat and moisture in equilibrium and the straight path. It is the Greatest Element (الاسطقص الأعظم), the origin of all elements. Water is the closest element to it, which is why Allah made every living thing from it. Water inherently accepts heating, whereas Fire accepts neither coldness nor moisture, neither essentially nor accidentally, unlike Water.

The greatest constellations are the airy constellations: Gemini, Libra, and Aquarius. When Allah created the Earth in seven layers (طباق), He made each earth smaller than the next, because there is a dome of heaven over each earth. When He created the Earth and <<وَقَدَّرَ فِيهَا أَقْوَاتَهَا>> (and determined therein its provisions), He clothed the Air in the form of copper, which is smoke. From that smoke, He <<خَلَقَ سَبْعَ سَمَاوَاتٍ طِبَاقًا>> (created seven heavens in layers), which are transparent bodies. He placed them over the Earth like domes; over each earth is a heaven whose edges form a hemisphere over it. The Earth is like a carpet for them; He spread it out (دحاها) so that the heaven could be upon it. When it shook, He fixed it with ropes (mountains), so it became heavy and settled by them. He placed a star in each heaven, which are the wandering planets (الجواري): the Moon in the lowest heaven, the Scribe (الكاتب), which is Mercury, in the second heaven, Venus in the third, the Sun in the fourth, the Red One (الأحمر), which is Mars, in the fifth, Jupiter (المشتري), which is Bahram, in the sixth, and Saturn (زحل), which is the Fighter (المقاتل), in the seventh, as we illustrated in the preceding example.

When all the stars swam and descended to the treasuries in the constellations, and the angels of the constellations bestowed upon them what they bestowed from those treasuries, they influenced the elements (الأركان), resulting in the generation of inanimate matter (جماد), which is mineral, plant, and animal. The last existing being is the human animal, the vicegerent of the Perfect Human (الإنسان الكامل), who is the manifest form (الصورة الظاهرة) by which the realities of the World (حقائق العالم) are gathered. The Perfect Human is the one who added the Realities of The Real (حقائق الحق) to the comprehensiveness of the realities of the World, by which the Vicegerency (الخلافة) became valid for him. This appeared in those who manifested these forms. He placed a perfect type of its genus in every class of generated beings (المولدات). The most perfect form that appeared in the mineral kingdom is the form of gold; in the plant kingdom, the *Waqwaq* tree; and in the animal kingdom, the human being. He placed intermediates between every two types, such as the truffle (الكمأة) between mineral and plant, the palm tree between plant and animal, and the *Nasnas* (a mythical half-human) and the ape between animal and human.

He breathed into every form He originated a spirit (روحا) from Himself, so it became alive. He introduced Himself to it through that spirit, and it recognized Him by the nature upon which that form was created. It only recognized Him from its own self, so it sees Him only in its own form. The forms were of different temperaments (أمزجة), even though they were created from a single soul, just as the hearts of the children of Adam were created by Allah from a single soul yet are diverse. Among the forms, some have their life concealed, so Allah veiled the sight of most people from them. These are of two types: one that has growth and nourishment, and one that has growth but no nourishment. We call the first type mineral and stone, and the second, plant. Among the forms, some have their life manifest, so we call them animal and living. In reality, all are living, possessing a rational soul (نفس ناطقة). It is impossible for there to be a form in the World that lacks a soul, life, or intrinsic and commanded worship (عبادة ذاتية وأمرية), whether that form is one that humans create as shapes, or one that animals create, or one that any creature creates, intentionally or unintentionally. No sooner is the form conceived, however it is conceived and by whose hands it appears, than the Exalted Allah clothes it with a spirit from His Command (أمره) and introduces Himself to it immediately. Thus, it recognizes Him through it and witnesses Him within it. This is the constant reality, in the World and the Hereafter, revealed by the people of Unveiling (أهل الكشف).

Night and day appeared with the rising and setting of the Sun. The entire day came into existence through the revolution of the Unstarred Sphere (الفلك الأطلس), just as time (الزمان) came into existence through the association of events when asking "When?" Time, the day, the night, and the seasons of the year are all relative non-existent matters (أمور عدمية نسبية) that have no existence in the fixed entities (الأعيان). He revealed to every heaven its command. He made the execution of the matters He entrusted to the heavens in the world of the elements (عالم الأركان) occur during the swimming of these wandering planets (الجواري). He made them deputies (نوابا) acting by the command of The Real (الحق) to implement these matters, which they took from the treasuries of the constellations (البروج) throughout the entire year. He decreed for them the known lunar mansions (المنازل) in the Starred Sphere (الفلك المكوكب), and He ordained for them conjunctions and separations, all by the decree of the All-Mighty, the All-Knowing. He made their movement circular, which is why He named them spheres (أفلاكا). On the surface of the seventh heaven, He placed *al-Dhirah* (The Elevated), which is the Frequented House (البيت المعمور), whose shape I have drawn in the margin.

In every heaven, He created a world of spirits (أرواح) and angels (ملائكة) who inhabit them. As for the angels, they are the ambassadors (السفراء) who descend with the interests of the World (العالم) that appeared in the elements (الأركان). These interests are known matters. The ambassadors have no knowledge of what results from the movements of all these stars and the movement of the Unstarred Sphere until it occurs. Thus, each of them has a known station (مقام معلوم) that he does not transgress. The occupation of the rest of the World is glorification (*tasbih*), prayer (*salat*), and praise of the Exalted Allah. Between the seventh heaven and the Starred Sphere are thrones (كراسي) upon which are forms resembling the forms of the responsible beings (المكلفين) from the two weighty groups (الثقلين: humans and jinn). Veils (ستور) are held up by purified angels whose sole task is to observe those forms, holding those veils in their hands. When the angel looks at the forms and sees that they have become ugly and changed from the beauty they possessed, he lowers the veil between it and the rest of the forms, so they do not know what has occurred. The angel from Allah continues to observe that form. When he sees that the ugliness has departed from the form and it has become beautiful, he raises the veil, and it appears in the best adornment. The glorification (*tasbih*) of those forms and these angelic spirits entrusted with the veils is: "Glory be to Him who manifests the beautiful and conceals the ugly." He informed the people of Unveiling (أهل الكشف) of this so that they may adopt the character traits of Allah (أخلاق الله) and behave courteously toward Allah's servants, manifesting the good qualities of the World and concealing their faults. The Divine Laws (الشرائع) came from Allah with this principle. If you see someone who claims qualification for Allah (الأهلية لله) yet acts contrary to this ruling toward the World, he is a liar in his claim.

By this and similar matters, the Glorified One is named the Forgiver (*al-Ghafir*), the All-Forgiving (*al-Ghafur*), and the Exceedingly Forgiving (*al-Ghaffar*). When Allah formed His Dominion (ملكوت) from what we mentioned, He created Adam with His Two Hands from the elements (الأركان), making the greatest part of him earth, due to its coldness and dryness. He sent him down as a vicegerent (خليفة) on His earth from which he was created. Before him, He had created the Jinn (الجان) from the elements, making the dominant part of them Fire. The matter of Adam, Iblis, and the angels was as Allah described for us in the Quran, so there is no need to mention it. Allah holds the form of the heaven upon the heaven for the sake of the Unitarian Human (الإنسان الموحد) who cannot negate [anything]. His remembrance is "Allah, Allah," because nothing is in his mind but Allah. He has no other thing whose divinity he might claim and then negate it with *La ilaha illa Allah* (There is no god but Allah). There is only Allah, the One, the Unique (الواحد الأحد). For this reason, the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said, "The Hour will not be established until there remains no one on the face of the earth who says, 'Allah, Allah.'" This is the Greatest Remembrance (الذكر الأكبر) of which Allah said, <<وَلَذِكْرُ اللهِ أَكْبَرُ>> (And the remembrance of Allah is greater). The Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him, did not say, "who says *La ilaha illa Allah*." This Name is the constant recitation of this Imam (leader) who is taken last, and then the Hour is established and the heaven splits open. For this [Imam] and his like were the pillars (العمد), because Allah held the heaven for his sake, <<أَنْ تَقَعَ عَلَى الْأَرْضِ>> (from falling upon the earth). That is why He said concerning it that it is <<وَاهِيَةٌ>> (weak/frail), meaning falling and collapsing. The deputies (النواب) continue to move in their paths, and forms appear through transformations (الاستحالات) in the world of the elements (عالم الأركان)—World, Isthmus (برزخ), and Hereafter—until Allah inherits <<الْأَرْضَ وَمَنْ عَلَيْهَا>> (the earth and whoever is upon it). Nothing remains except what is in the Hereafter, which is the Day of Resurrection (يوم القيامة), and the two abodes: the Garden (الجنة) and the Fire (النار). Each of them will be filled with jinn, humans, and whatever Allah wills. In the Garden is the Foot of Truth (قدم الصدق), and in the Fire is the Foot of the Compeller (قدم الجبار). These are the two Feet that are upon the Footstool (الكرسي). What has been mentioned in this art within this book is sufficient for the rational person and provides a traveler's provision to reach his destination.

### Chapter Five: Concerning the Land of Gathering (أرض الحشر) and what it contains of the World, the Levels (المراتب), the Throne of Separation and Judgment (عرش الفصل والقضاء), its bearers, and the ranks of the angels upon it before the Just Judge.

### [The Difference Between the Manifest Existence of the World and the Manifest Existence of the Hereafter]

Know that when the Exalted Allah blows the Trumpet (الصور), resurrects what is in the graves, gathers humans and beasts, and <<وَأَخْرَجَتِ الْأَرْضُ أَثْقَالَهَا>> (and the earth discharges its burdens), nothing remains in its belly except its own entity (عينها)—an expulsion, not a growth. This is the difference between the manifest existence of the World (نشأة الدنيا الظاهرة) and the manifest existence of the Hereafter (نشأة الآخرة الظاهرة). In the former, we were grown in the earth, so we grew like plants, gradually, accepting increase in mass, length, and width. The existence of the Hereafter is an expulsion from the earth in the form that The Real (الحق) wills to bring us forth upon. That is why He linked the Will (المشيئة) to the spreading of the form that He returned to the earth, which is described as growing, so it grows without a precedent, because there is no form among the forms that resembles it. Likewise, the existence of the Hereafter is manifested by Allah without a precedent form that resembles it. That is His saying, <<كَمَا بَدَأَكُمْ تَعُودُونَ>> (As He originated you, you will return), and <<وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْتُمُ النَّشْأَةَ الْأُولَى فَلَوْلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ>> (And you have already known the first creation, so why do you not remember?), and <<وَنُنْشِئَكُمْ فِي مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ>> (And We will create you in that which you do not know).

When <<أَخْرَجَتِ الْأَرْضُ أَثْقَالَهَا>> (the earth discharges its burdens) and reports that nothing remains within it of what it had stored, the World (العالم) will be brought to the darkness below the Bridge (الجسر) and cast into it until they cannot see one another, nor can they perceive how the change in the heaven and the earth occurs until it happens. The Earth is first stretched out like a hide and flattened, so <<لَا تَرَى فِيهَا عِوَجًا وَلَا أَمْتًا>> (you will see therein no deviation nor unevenness). This is *al-Sahira* (The Vigilant Plain), where there is no sleep, for no one sleeps after the World. What is beneath the concave surface of the Starred Sphere (الفلك المكوكب) reverts to Hell (جهنم). It was named by this name due to the distance of its bottom (its depth). Where is the concave surface in relation to the Earth? The Bridge (الصراط) is placed, rising straight from the Earth to the surface of the Starred Sphere, terminating at the meadow (*al-Marj*) outside the wall of the Garden. The first Garden people enter is the Garden of Delight (جنة النعيم). In that meadow is the banquet (المأدبة), which is pure white flour (*durmaka*). The people of the banquet eat from it. This is His saying concerning the believers among the Children of Israel if they upheld the Torah and the Gospel: <<وَلَوْ أَنَّهُمْ أَقَامُوا التَّوْرَاةَ وَالْإِنْجِيلَ وَمَا أُنْزِلَ إِلَيْهِمْ مِنْ رَبِّهِمْ لَأَكَلُوا مِنْ فَوْقِهِمْ وَمِنْ تَحْتِ أَرْجُلِهِمْ>> (And if they had upheld the Torah and the Gospel and what was revealed to them from their Lord, they would have eaten from above them and from beneath their feet). We, the community of Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him, uphold everything revealed to us from our Lord through faith, and we act upon what we were commanded to act upon. Other communities, some believed as we believed, and some believed in part and disbelieved in part. For those among them who are saved, it is said concerning them, <<لَأَكَلُوا مِنْ فَوْقِهِمْ>> (they would have eaten from above them), which is what emerged from the branches of the Garden trees over the wall, casting shade upon this meadow, and the blessed ones pluck it. And <<وَمِنْ تَحْتِ أَرْجُلِهِمْ>> (from beneath their feet) is what they eat from the white *durmaka* upon which they stand.

The Scales (الموازين) are placed in the Land of Gathering (أرض الحشر); every responsible person (مكلف) has a scale specific to him. A wall called *al-A'raf* (The Heights) is erected between the Garden and the Fire, and He made it a place for those whose scale pans were equal, neither outweighing the other. The Guardian Angels (الحفظة) stand, holding the books they wrote in the World concerning the deeds and sayings of the responsible persons. These books contain nothing of their heart's beliefs except what they testified to against themselves through their utterances. They fasten these books around their necks with their own hands. Some take their book in their right hand, some in their left, and some take it from behind their backs. These are the ones who cast the Book aside in the World <<وَرَاءَ ظُهُورِهِمْ وَاشْتَرَوْا بِهِ ثَمَنًا قَلِيلًا>> (behind their backs and exchanged it for a small price). These are none other than the misguided leaders (الأئمة الضلال المضلون) who went astray and led others astray.

The Basin (الحوض) is brought, water flowing onto it from vessels equal to the number of those who drink from it, neither increasing nor decreasing. Two pipes flow into it: a pipe of gold and a pipe of silver. It is adjacent to the wall, and these two pipes emerge from the wall. The believers drink from it. Pulpits (منابر) of light, varying in illumination and color, are brought and erected in that land. A group of people is brought and seated upon them, enveloped in lights, whom no one recognizes. Upon them is the eternal Mercy, consisting of Divine robes of honor (الخلع الإلهية) that delight their eyes. With every human comes his companion (قرينه) from the devils and the angels. The banners (الألوية) are unfurled on that Day for the blessed and the wretched, held by their leaders (أئمتهم) who called them to what they called them to, whether truth or falsehood. Every community gathers around its Messenger, both those who believed in him and those who disbelieved. Individuals and Prophets are gathered apart from the people, unlike the Messengers, who are masters of armies and have a station specific to them. Allah has designated a great level (مرتبة عظمى) in this land, before the Throne of Separation and Judgment (عرش الفصل والقضاء), extending from the *Wasila* (الوسيلة) in the Garden. This is called the Praised Station (المقام المحمود), and it belongs exclusively to Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him.

The angels come—the angels of the heavens—the angels of each heaven separately, distinguished from the others, forming seven ranks (صفوف), the inhabitants of each heaven forming one rank. The Spirit (الروح) stands at the head of the assembly; He is the angel who descended with the Divine Laws (الشرائع) upon the Messengers. Then the revealed Books and Scrolls are brought, and every group for whom they were revealed stands behind them. They are distinguished from the people of the intervals (أصحاب الفترات) and from those who worshipped by a book that was not revealed for them, but which they entered into, abandoning their own law (ناموس) because it was from Allah, and their law was based on the rational contemplation of a guided, rational person.

Then Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, comes upon His Throne (عرشه), and the eight angels carry that Throne and place it in that land. The Divine Awe (الهيبة الإلهية) is known and overcomes the hearts of the inhabitants of the station—human, angel, jinn, and beast—so they speak only in whispers, with a glance of the eye and a hidden voice. The veils (الحجب) between Allah and His servants are lifted—this is the Unveiling of the Shin (كشف الساق). The caller of The Real (داعي الحق), by Allah's command, orders them to prostrate to Allah. No one who prostrated to Allah sincerely, regardless of his religion, remains except that he performs the customary prostration. But whoever prostrated out of precaution or hypocrisy falls onto the back of his head. By this prostration, the scale of the people of *al-A'raf* (The Heights) outweighs, because it is a prostration of responsibility (سجدة تكليف). Thus, they are made happy and enter the Garden. The Real (الحق) begins the separation and judgment between His servants concerning what was between them. As for what was between them and Allah, the Divine Generosity (الكرم الإلهي) has dropped it, so Allah does not hold any of His servants accountable for what does not involve the right of another. Reports concerning the Prophets, peace be upon them, on that Day have been transmitted through the tongues of the Messengers, and people have recorded what they recorded concerning it. Whoever desires the details of these matters should look for them there.

Then the first intercession (الشفاعة الأولى) occurs from Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him, for every intercessor to intercede. The intercessors intercede, and Allah accepts from their intercession what He wills and rejects what He wills, because on that Day, Allah spreads Mercy in the hearts of the intercessors. Whoever's intercession Allah rejects among the intercessors, He does not reject it out of disrespect for them or lack of mercy for the one interceded for. Rather, He intends by this to manifest the Divine Favor (المنة الإلهية) upon some of His servants, so Allah Himself undertakes their happiness and the removal of wretchedness from them. For some, this is removed by their expulsion from the Fire to the Gardens. It has been reported that his intercession is by the intercession of the Most Merciful of the Merciful (أرحم الراحمين) before the Avenger, the Compeller (المنتقم الجبار). These are levels of Divine Names (أسماء إلهية), not a realized intercession. For Allah says on that Day, "The angels, the prophets, and the believers have interceded, and the Most Merciful of the Merciful remains." This implies that He did not intercede, but rather undertakes by Himself the expulsion of whomever He wills from the Fire to the Garden, and the transfer of the state of those who are people of the Fire from the wretchedness of pains to the happiness of their removal. That is the measure of their delight.

He may will, and Allah fills Hell (جهنم) with His mixed Wrath and His Decree, and the Garden (الجنة) with His Good Pleasure (رضاه). Thus, Mercy becomes universal, and favor is spread. Creation then becomes, just as they were in the World, upon the Form of The Real (صورة الحق), so they transform due to His transformation. The last form He transforms into, in judging His servants, is the Form of Good Pleasure (صورة الرضاء), so The Real transforms into the Form of Delight (صورة النعيم). For the Merciful and the Pardoner is the first to show mercy, pardon, and bestow favor upon Himself by removing the distress and wrath He felt toward the one who angered Him. Then that [mercy] spreads to the one who was subject to wrath. Whoever understands this, we have secured him; and whoever does not understand will soon know and understand, for the final outcome (المال) is to Him.

Allah, from the perspective of His knowledge of Himself, His Ipseity (هويته), and His richness, is upon what He is. This [description] reported in the traditions and granted by Unveiling (الكشف) are merely states (أحوال) that appear, stations (مقامات) that are personified, and meanings that are embodied, so that The Real (الحق) may teach His servants the meaning of the Manifest Divine Name (الاسم الإلهي الظاهر)—which is all that has appeared from this—and the meaning of the Inner Divine Name (الاسم الإلهي الباطن)—which is His Ipseity. He has named Himself to us by both. Everything in the World—disposition, reversal, and transformation into forms, concerning The Real and creation—is due to the ruling of the Manifest Name (الاسم الظاهر). This is the limit of the knowledge of the World and the scholars of Allah (العلماء بالله). As for the Inner Name (الاسم الباطن), it belongs to Him, not to us. What we possess of it is only <<لَيْسَ كَمِثْلِهِ شَيْءٌ>> (There is nothing like unto Him), according to some of its possible interpretations, except that the descriptions of Transcendence (التنزيه) are related to the Inner Name, even though this involves limitation. However, nothing more than this is possible, for it is the utmost limit of understanding granted by our preparedness. As for His saying, the Exalted, <<وَإِنْ مِنْكُمْ إِلَّا وَارِدُهَا>> (And there is none of you except that he will reach it), this is because the path to the Garden is upon it, so arrival (الورود) is inevitable. When none of the people of the Garden remain in the Land of Gathering (أرض الحشر), the entire land reverts to Fire—meaning, the Abode of Fire—even though it contains extreme cold (*zamharir*). Hell (جهنم) extends from the concave surface of the Starred Sphere down to the lowest of the low.

### Chapter Six: Concerning Hell (جهنم), its Gates, its Stations, and its Lowest Levels (دركاتها).

Know that Hell (جهنم) encompasses the heavens and the earth, returning to the state they were in when they were joined together (رتقا). It has reverted to its quality of being joined. All the stars rise and set within it upon the people of the Fire, bringing scorching heat (*harur*) and extreme cold (*zamharir*). The scorching heat is for those who were cold, after the full exaction of accountability for their crimes, and the extreme cold is for those who were hot, so that they may find delight and pleasure in that, for they have no delight other than that, and it is perpetual upon them forever. Likewise, their food and drink, after the period of accountability ends, they consume from the Zaqqum Tree, tailored for each person according to what cools down what he was experiencing or heats it up. This is like the thirsty person suffering from the heat of thirst who finds cold water and experiences pleasure from its removal of the heat of thirst, and similarly its opposite.

Its gates are seven, corresponding to the manifest limbs of responsibility (أعضاء التكليف الظاهرة), because the gate of the heart (القلب) is sealed; it has not been opened since Allah sealed it when the heart affirmed His Lordship (الربوبية) and its own servitude (العبودية) to its Lord. Thus, the Fire has access to the hearts (الأفئدة) but no entry, due to the sealing of that gate. It is like the Garden, surrounded by hardships. Allah only mentioned the seven gates of the Fire through which humans and jinn enter. As for the sealed gate, which no one enters, it is in the wall. Its interior contains Mercy, due to the heart's affirmation of Allah's existence as its Lord and its servitude to its Lord, while its exterior, facing it, is the torment—which is the Fire that rises over the hearts.

As for its stations (منازلها), lowest levels (دركاتها), and small windows (خوخاتها), they are exactly as we mentioned for the Garden, neither increasing nor decreasing. There is no Fire of inheritance (نار ميراث) or Fire of specialization (نار اختصاص); rather, there is the Fire of deeds (نار أعمال). Some inhabit it by themselves and their deeds, which are their companions. As for the deeds of one who is among the people of the Garden, his deed that was performed in the World remains in its form in the place in the Fire where the doer of that deed would have been if he were among its people. For the existence of that deed originated from that place, being contrary to what he was commanded to do or refrain from. Thus, it returns to its homeland, just as the body returns to the earth from which it was created upon death. Everything returns to its origin, even if the duration is long, for they are counted breaths and fixed, limited terms, during which the Book reaches its term, and every hopeful person sees what he hoped for. We are only by Him and for Him, so we have not departed from ourselves, nor have we resided except within ourselves, wherever we were.

All the wild beasts (الوحوش) are gathered in it, as a favor from Allah upon them, except for the gazelles and the animals used in the way of Allah, for they are in the Gardens (الجنان) in forms necessitated by that station, and every animal that the people of the Garden specifically consumed in the World. When no one remains in the Fire except its inhabitants, and they are in a state of torment, Death (الموت) is brought in the form of a speckled ram. It is placed between the Garden and the Fire. The people of the Garden and the people of the Fire look at it, and they are asked, "Do you recognize this?" They say, "Yes, this is Death." The Trustworthy Spirit (الروح الأمين) lays it down, and John (Yahya), peace be upon him, comes with a blade in his hand and slaughters it. The angel says to the inhabitants of the Garden and the Fire, "Eternity, so no death." Despair falls upon the people of the Fire regarding their exit from it, and the possibility of leaving is removed from the hearts of the people of the Garden. The gates are closed, which is simultaneously the opening of the gates of the Garden, for they are shaped such that when one gate opens, another place is closed by it. Thus, the closing of one station is the opening of another station.

### [The Names of the Seven Gates of Hell (جهنم)]

The names of its seven gates are: the Gate of Hell (جهنم), the Gate of the Blazing Fire (الجحيم), the Gate of the Burning Fire (السعير), the Gate of Saqar (سقر), the Gate of Laza (لظى), the Gate of the Crushing Fire (الحطمة), and the Gate of Sijjin (سجين). The sealed gate, which is the eighth and does not open, is the Veil (الحجاب).

As for the apertures of the branches of faith, whoever adheres to one of these branches receives a Self-disclosure (تجلي) corresponding to that branch, whatever it may be. Some of these branches are an innate disposition (خلق) imprinted upon the servant, and some are acquired. Every good deed originates from the Pure Good. Thus, whoever performs a good deed, in whatever manner, shall see it and be rewarded for it. And whoever commits an evil deed must inevitably see it; he may be punished for it, or he may be forgiven and have it exchanged for good, provided he repented in this world. But if he dies without repentance, it must inevitably be exchanged for what corresponds to it, according to the requirement of his remorse on the Day they are resurrected. Humans, the Jinn (الجان), and every responsible being (مكلف) shall see their deeds. That which the responsible being felt alienation (يستوحش) from upon seeing it will return to him as intimacy (أنس) with it. The forms and states in the two abodes (الدارين) change with the moments (الأنفاس), corresponding to the variation of passing thoughts (الخواطر) here in the world. For the inner reality of the human in this world is the manifest reality in the Hereafter. What was hidden (غيبا) here becomes witnessed (شهادة) there. And the Essence (العين) remains hidden (غيبا), the inner reality of these forms and images, which neither changes nor transforms. There is nothing there except images and forms that are perpetually put off and put on, eternally, without end or cessation.

### «Chapter Seven» Concerning the Divine Presence of the Names (حضرة الأسماء الإلهية), the World, the Hereafter, and the Isthmus (البرزخ)

Know that the Beautiful Names of Allah are relations and attributions (نسب وإضافات). Among them are leaders (أئمة) and custodians (سدنة). Some of these Names are necessarily required by the contingent beings (الممكنات), and some are not required by the contingent beings with that same necessity. The strength of their relation to the Real (الحق) is more fundamental than their demand upon Creation (الخلق).

Those Names which are indispensable for the contingent being are the Living (الحي), the Knowing (العالم), the Willing (المريد), and the Speaker (القائل) (by way of Unveiling [كشفا]), which, in rational consideration (النظر العقلي), is the Powerful (القادر). These four are demanded by Creation (الخلق) in its very essence. Nature (الطبيعة) relies upon these four, just as the elements (الأركان) rely upon Nature, and just as the humors (الأخلاط) rely upon the elements. Upon these four also rely, in their manifestation, the mothers of the categories (أمهات المقولات): Substance (الجوهر), Accident (العرض), Time (الزمان), and Place (المكان).

The remaining Names act as custodians (سدنة) for these Names. Following these are two Names: the Disposer (المدبر) and the Distinguisher (المفصل); then the Generous (الجواد) and the Equitable (المقسط). From these two Names arose the World of the Unseen and the World of Witnessing (عالم الغيب والشهادة), the abode of this world (الدنيا) and the Hereafter (الآخرة). From them came affliction (البلاء) and well-being (العافية), Paradise (الجنة) and the Fire (النار). From them were created <<مِنْ كُلٍّ زَوْجَيْنِ اثْنَيْنِ>> (from every pair, two), ease (السراء) and hardship (الضراء). From them originated the two praises (التحميدان) in the cosmos: the first praise, "Praise be to Allah, the Benefactor, the Fulfiller of Grace (المنعم المفضل)," and the second praise, "Praise be to Allah in every state (على كل حال)." From these two Names appeared the two powers in the soul: the cognitive power (القوة العلمية) and the practical power (القوة العملية), potentiality and act, coming-to-be (الكون) and transformation (الاستحالة), the Higher Assembly (الملإ الأعلى) and the Lower Assembly (الملإ الأسفل), and Creation (الخلق) and Command (الأمر).

Since the Divine Names are relations (نسب) demanded by their effects, it is not necessary that any Name whose ruling is suspended should remain suspended. This objection would only arise if they happened to be existential realities. But Allah is God (إله) whether the World (العالم) exists or does not exist. Indeed, some deluded people imagine that the Names, when applied to the Named, indicate existential entities (أعيان وجودية) subsisting in the Essence of the Real (ذات الحق). If the ruling of these Names were not universal, then some of them would remain suspended, having no effect. Therefore, we say that if He, glory be to Him, were to show mercy to the entire World (العالم), it would be possible; and if He were to punish the entire World, it would be possible; and if He were to show mercy to some and punish others, it would be possible; and if He were to punish it for a specified term, it would be possible. For The Necessary Existent (الواجب الوجود) is not prevented from doing what is possible in itself, nor is He compelled regarding what He executes in His Creation (الخلق). Rather, He is the Doer of what He wills.

When Allah created the World (العالم), we saw that it possessed different levels (مراتب) and realities (حقائق), each reality demanding a specific relation (نسبة خاصة) from the Real (الحق). Thus, when the Exalted One sent His Messengers, He sent them, because of those relations (نسب), with Names by which He named Himself to His Creation (الخلق). From these Names, one understands their indication of His Exalted Essence (ذاته تعالى) and of an intelligible matter that has no entity (عين) in existence, yet possesses the ruling of this effect and the reality manifest in the World (العالم)—such as creation (خلق), provision (رزق), benefit (نفع), harm (ضر), bringing into existence (إيجاد), specification (اختصاص), rulings (أحكام), dominance (غلبة), subjugation (قهر), subtlety (لطف), descent (تنزل), attraction (استجلاب), love (محبة), hatred (بغض), nearness (قرب), distance (بعد), magnification (تعظيم), and belittlement (تحقير). Every attribute manifest in the World demands a specific relation (نسبة خاصة) that has a known Name according to the Divine Law (الشرع).

Some of these Names are shared (مشتركة), although each shared Name, when clarified, reveals a distinct meaning. The fundamental principle regarding the Names is distinction (التباين), and the sharing is merely verbal. Some are distinct (متباينة), and some are synonymous (مترادفة). Yet, even with synonymity, a meaning must be understood from each Name that is not present in the other.

Thus, we know what He named Himself and we restrict ourselves to those Names. He brought into existence the abode of this world (الدار الدنيا) and settled the animals therein, and He made the Perfect Human (الإنسان الكامل) an Imam and Caliph within it, granting him the knowledge of the Names and the meanings they indicate. He subjugated to this human, his children, and his descendants, all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth.

And He created a creation (خلقا) such that if you say it is existent, you speak truly; and if you say it is non-existent, you speak truly; and if you say it is neither existent nor non-existent, you speak truly. This is Imagination (الخيال). Imagination has two states: a state of connection (اتصال), which it possesses through the existence of the human and some animals; and a state of separation (انفصال), which is that to which external perception relates, being distinct from it in reality, such as Gabriel appearing in the form of Dihya, or any being, angelic or otherwise, that manifests from the World of the Veil (عالم الستر) in Paradise.

He created Paradise (الجنة) and the dwelling that will be the Fire (نارا) on the Day of Resurrection. He created what He created from the Fire, and what remained of it remained in potentiality. He placed this within the transformations (الاستحالات) that Allah established in this natural existence. Thus, what is today the abode of this world (دار دنيا) will tomorrow, in the Resurrection (القيامة), be the abode of Hell (دار جهنم). This is in the Knowledge of Allah, and we have explained this approximately in the preceding exemplary image (الصورة المثالية) in this chapter.

### «Chapter Eight» Concerning the Dune (الكثيب) and the Levels of Creation (الخلق) therein

Know that the Dune (الكثيب) is white musk in the Garden of Eden (جنة عدن). The Garden of Eden is the capital and fortress of Paradise, the Presence of the King and His elect (خواصه). The common people (العامة) do not enter it except by way of visitation.

In this Dune, He placed pulpits, couches, chairs, and ranks (مراتب), because the people of the Dune are four groups: believers, saints (أولياء), prophets (أنبياء), and messengers (رسل). And the individuals of every category we mentioned excel one another. The Exalted said: <<تِلْكَ الرُّسُلُ فَضَّلْنا بَعْضَهُمْ عَلى‏ بَعْضٍ>> (Those Messengers—We preferred some of them over others), and He said: <<وَلَقَدْ فَضَّلْنا بَعْضَ النَّبِيِّينَ عَلى‏ بَعْضٍ>> (And We have certainly preferred some of the prophets over others). Their stations (منازلهم) are preferred according to their excellence, even if they share the same abode. Related to this is His saying: <<وَرَفَعَ بَعْضَكُمْ فَوْقَ بَعْضٍ دَرَجاتٍ>> (And He raised some of you above others in degrees)—meaning Creation (الخلق)—which includes all the children of Adam, both in this world and the Hereafter.

When people have taken their stations in Paradise, the Real (الحق) summons them to His Vision (رؤيته). They hasten according to their mounts and their pace here in obedience to their Lord: some are slow, some are fast, and some are moderate. They gather at the Dune (الكثيب), and every person knows his rank (مرتبته) by necessary knowledge (علما ضروريا). He rushes toward it and settles nowhere else, just as an infant rushes to the breast or iron to the magnet. If he wished to settle in a rank other than his own, he would not be able; and if he wished to be passionately devoted to a station other than his own, he would not be able. Rather, he sees in his own station that he has reached the limit of his hope and intention. Thus, he is passionately devoted to the bliss (النعيم) he is in, a natural, essential devotion (تعشقا طبيعيا ذاتيا). Nothing, in his view, could be better than his current state. Were it not so, it would be an abode of pain and distress, and not Paradise (جنة) or an abode of bliss (نعيم). However, the one who is higher has bliss in his station, and he also possesses the bliss of the lower one. The lowest person in rank—though there is no one so low as to have no bliss—has bliss only in his specific station. The highest person, above whom there is none higher, has bliss in the totality. Thus, the bliss of every person is confined to himself. How wondrous is this ruling!

In the first Vision (الرؤية الأولى), the veil (الحجاب) is magnified for the people of the Fire, along with distress and torment, such that they experience no torment more severe than that. This first Vision occurs before the term of punishment ends and before the universal, encompassing Mercy (الرحمة الشاملة) takes effect, so that they may taste the torment of the veil (الحجاب). In the second Vision and thereafter, Mercy becomes universal. They—meaning the people of Hell (أهل الجحيم)—have a vision through the apertures (خوخات) of the gates of the Fire, corresponding to the noble moral qualities (مكارم الأخلاق) they possessed in the world.

When people descend upon the Dune (الكثيب) for the Vision (الرؤية), the Real (الحق) Exalted manifests a universal Self-disclosure (تجلّيا عاما) upon the forms of beliefs (صور الاعتقادات) in that single Theophany (التجلي الواحد). It is one insofar as it is a Self-disclosure (تجل), and it is multiple insofar as the forms differ. When they see Him, they are all dyed by the light of that Self-disclosure (التجلي), and each one appears with the light of the form he witnessed. Whoever’s knowledge encompasses every belief receives the light of every belief. Whoever’s knowledge is confined to a specific, determined belief receives only the light of that determined belief. And whoever believes in an Existence (وجودا) concerning which he makes no ruling, neither by transcendence (تنزيه) nor by anthropomorphism (تشبيه), but whose belief is that He is as He is, neither transcending nor anthropomorphizing, and who believes in what came from Him, the Exalted, based on His own Knowledge of Himself, glory be to Him—that person receives the light of specialization (نور الاختصاص), which is known only at that time, for it is in the Knowledge of Allah. It is not known whether he is higher than the one whose knowledge encompassed all beliefs, or equal to him, but he is certainly not lower.

When Allah wills their return to the witnessing of their bliss (نعيمهم) through that Vision in their Gardens, He says to the angels who distribute the Dune (الكثيب), "Return them to their palaces." They return bearing the form they saw, and they find their stations and their families dyed with that form, and they take pleasure in it. For at the time of witnessing (المشاهدة), they were in a state of annihilation (فناء) from themselves, so they did not experience pleasure during the time of their vision. Rather, at the very beginning of the Self-disclosure (التجلي), the ruling of its sovereignty overwhelmed them, annihilating them from it and from themselves. Thus, they are in pleasure while in a state of annihilation (فناء) due to the greatness of its sovereignty. But when they perceive that form in their stations and their families, the pleasure continues for them, and they enjoy that witnessing. Thus, in this station, they enjoy the very thing that annihilated them at the Dune (الكثيب).

And in that Self-disclosure (التجلي) and that Vision (الرؤية), they increase in Knowledge of Allah, which direct vision (العيان) grants them and which they did not possess before. For when the known is witnessed, its witnessing imparts something that cannot be obtained without witnessing, as has been said:

> But direct vision holds a subtle meaning,
> For this reason, the one who spoke [to God] (al-Kalīm) asked for the witnessing.

This is a spiritual taste (ذوق) known by everyone who is established in this state, and he cannot deny it to himself.

### «Chapter Nine» Concerning the World (العالم)

It is everything other than Allah, and its arrangement (نضده) and structure, spiritually and physically, high and low.

[That the World (العالم) is everything other than Allah]

Know that the World (العالم) is everything other than Allah. It is nothing but the contingent beings (الممكنات), whether they exist or not. For they are, in their very essence, a sign (علامة) of our knowledge, or of the Knowledge of The Necessary Existent by His Essence (واجب الوجود لذاته), who is Allah. Contingency (الإمكان) is a necessary ruling for them, both in their state of non-existence and their state of existence. Rather, it is intrinsic to them, because determination (الترجيح) is necessary for them, and thus the Determiner (المرجح) is known. For this reason, it is called *‘ālam* (World/Cosmos), derived from *‘alāma* (sign), because it is the proof of the Determiner. Understand this.

The World (العالم), in its state of existence, is nothing but the forms that the Cloud (العماء) accepted and that manifested within it. If you consider the reality of the World, it is merely a vanishing accident (عرض زائل)—that is, subject to vanishing. This is His saying, the Exalted: <<كُلُّ شَيْءٍ هَالِكٌ إِلَّا وَجْهَهُ>> (Everything will perish except His Face/Essence). And the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said, "The truest verse spoken by the Arabs is the saying of Labīd:

> Behold, everything other than Allah is vain (bāṭil).

He means that it has no reality upon which it subsists by itself; it exists only through another. For this reason, he, peace and blessings be upon him, said, "The truest verse spoken by the Arabs is: Behold, everything other than Allah is vain (bāṭil)."

Thus, the subsisting substance (الجوهر الثابت) is the Cloud (العماء), which is none other than the very Breath of the Merciful (نفس الرحمن). The World (العالم) is all the forms that appeared within it, which are accidents (أعراض) within it that can be removed. Those forms are the contingent beings (الممكنات). Their relation to the Cloud (العماء) is the relation of images to a mirror: they appear within it for the eye of the beholder. The Real (الحق), Exalted is He, is the sight of the World (العالم); He is the Seer, and He is the Knower of the contingent beings (الممكنات). He perceives nothing except the forms of the contingent beings that are in His Knowledge. Thus, the World (العالم) appeared between the Cloud (العماء) and the Vision of the Real (الحق). What appeared was therefore a proof of the Seer, who is the Real. Be aware of this, and know who you are.

As for its structure (نضده) in terms of manifestation and arrangement, it consists of luminous Divine Spirits (أرواح نورية إلهية) immersed (مهيمة) in luminous, creative, originated forms within the substance of the Breath (نفس) which is the Cloud (العماء). Among these are the First Intellect (العقل الأول), which is the Pen (القلم); then the Soul (النفس), which is the Preserved Tablet (اللوح المحفوظ); then the Body; then the Throne (العرش) and its location, which is solidified water, air, and darkness; then its angels; then the Footstool (الكرسي); then its angels; then the Atlas Sphere (الأطلس); then its angels; then the Sphere of the Lunar Mansions (فلك المنازل); then the Gardens (الجنات) with all they contain; then the stars specific to them and to this sphere; then the Earth; then Water; then the elemental Air; then Fire; then Smoke.

And He split open within it seven heavens: the heaven of the Moon, the heaven of the Scribe (Mercury), the heaven of Venus, the heaven of the Sun, the heaven of the Red One (Mars), the heaven of Jupiter, and the heaven of the Fighter (Saturn); then their spheres created from them; then the angels of Fire, Water, Air, and Earth; then the generated things (المولدات): mineral, plant, and animal; then the formation of the human body; then the individuals that appeared from every species of animal, plant, and mineral; then the created forms resulting from the deeds of the responsible beings (المكلفين), which is the last category. This is its arrangement in terms of manifestation in creation.

As for its arrangement according to existential or imagined place: the imagined place includes the intelligibles (المعقولات) we mentioned up to the Total Body (الجسم الكل); then the Throne (العرش); then the Footstool (الكرسي); then the Atlas Sphere (الأطلس); then the Starry Sphere (المكوكب), which contains the Gardens (الجنات); then the heaven of Saturn (زحل); then the heaven of Jupiter (المشتري); then the heaven of Mars (المريخ); then the heaven of the Sun (الشمس); then the heaven of Venus (الزهرة); then the heaven of the Scribe (الكاتب); then the heaven of the Moon (القمر); then the Aether; then the Air; then the Water; then the Earth.

As for its arrangement according to rank (المكانة): the Perfect Human (الإنسان الكامل); then the First Intellect (العقل الأول); then the Immersed Spirits (الأرواح المهيمة); then the Soul (النفس); then the Throne (العرش); then the Footstool (الكرسي); then the Atlas Sphere (الأطلس); then the Dune (الكثيب); then the Means (الوسيلة); then Eden (عدن); then Paradise (الفردوس); then the Abode of Peace (دار السلام); then the Abode of Residence (دار المقامة); then the Refuge (المأوى); then Eternity (الخلد); then Bliss (النعيم); then the Sphere of the Lunar Mansions (فلك المنازل); then the Frequented House (البيت المعمور); then the heaven of the Sun; then the Moon; then Jupiter; then Saturn (زحل); then Venus; then the Scribe (Mercury); then Mars; then the Air; then the Water; then the Dust; then the Fire; then the Animal; then the Plant; then the Mineral. Among people: the Messengers (الرسل); then the Prophets (الأنبياء); then the Saints (الأولياء); then the Believers (المؤمنون); then the rest of Creation (الخلق). Among the nations: the community of Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him; then the community of Moses, peace be upon him; then the nations according to the ranks of their Messengers.

As for its arrangement according to influence (التأثير): some influence by state (الحال), some influence by spiritual resolve (الهمة), some influence by speech (القول), and some influence by action (الفعل)—meaning by means of an instrument. Some influence by the totality of all these, and some influence by the totality of some of these. Some influence without intention for the effect that appears from them, such as the influence of winds blowing upon sands and other things, which is the image of forms. There is nothing in Existence (الوجود) except an influencer and that which is influenced, absolutely. And the influenced (مؤثر, passive participle) is that which has an effect by state, such as forms that come into being and influence by state the Giver of Spirits to them.

We have mentioned a sermon concerning the structure (نضد) of the World (العالم), which is the one I am about to mention. [Mention of the Sermon on the Structure of the Serious World]

Praise be to Allah, whose beginning has no commencement, unlike all other beginnings; to whom belong the Beautiful Names (الأسماء الحسنى) and the Exalted, Eternal Attributes (الصفات العلى الأزليات); the Existent when there was neither Intellect, nor Soul, nor simple substances, nor composite substances, nor earth, nor heavens. The Knower (العالم) in the Cloud (العماء) of all known things; the Powerful (القادر) who is not incapable of possibilities; the Willing (المريد) who does not fall short, so that impossibilities would render Him incapable; the Speaker (المتكلم) without letters or sounds; the Hearer (السميع) who hears His own speech, though no speech is heard except through letters, sounds, instruments, and melodies; the Seer (البصير) who saw His Essence (ذاته) when there were no imprinted visible entities; the Living (الحي) for whom the attributes of eternal Oneness (الأحدي) and the Self-Sufficient Station (الصمدي) are necessary. Exalted is He by these characteristics. He who made the Perfect Human (الإنسان الكامل) the noblest of existents and the most complete of originated Words (الكلمات المحدثات). And prayers be upon our Master Muhammad, the best of creatures, the master of the corporeal and the spiritual, the possessor of the Means (الوسيلة) in the Gardens of Paradise (الجنات الفردوسيات), and the Praised Station (المقام المحمود) on the great Day of calamities and painful misfortunes.

To proceed: When He, glory be to Him, willed to bring things into existence from non-existence, and to manifest them in their entities (أعيانها) with the definitions and limits they require—for the manifestation of the sovereignty of accidents (الأعراض), properties (الخواص), differentiae (الفصول), species (الأنواع), and genera (الأجناس), which repel the semblance of doubts and lift the veils of confusion—by means of explanatory expressions and luminous, guiding essential and formal attributes. Thus, in the form of Knowledge (العلم), the images of similar substances (الجواهر المتماثلات), and differing, similar, and opposing accidents (الأعراض) were disclosed. He distinguished between these essences (الذوات)—between those that occupy space and those that do not—just as the images of forms and states were disclosed in the essences of accidents and substances by means of qualities (الكيفيات); and the images of connected and separated measures and weights by means of quantities (الكميات); and the images of temporal cycles and movements (الحركات الزمانيات); and the images of spatial regions and spheres (الأكوار المكانيات); and the preserving images that maintain the order of the World (نظام العالم), bearing the causes of accidental merits and faults, the causes of legal praises and blames, and the causes of conventional, philosophical soundness and corruption. And the images of relations (الإضافات) between the owner and the owned, fathers, sons, and daughters; and the images of ownership through external male and female slaves, and internal beauty, handsomeness, and knowledge, and their likes; and the images of active orientations subsisting in the agents (الفاعلات); and the images of passive entities (المنفعلات) which are connected to the act and the agents. And He said when He disclosed them: <<وَالشَّمْسِ وَضُحَاهَا * وَالْقَمَرِ إِذَا تَلَاهَا * وَالنَّهَارِ إِذَا جَلَّاهَا * وَاللَّيْلِ إِذَا يَغْشَاهَا * وَالسَّمَاءِ وَمَا بَنَاهَا * وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا طَحَاهَا>> (By the sun and its brightness, and the moon when it follows it, and the day when it displays it, and the night when it covers it, and the heaven and He who built it, and the earth and He who spread it). These are the realities (حقائق) of the celestial Fathers and the terrestrial Mothers. They possess subsistence (البقاء) through His sustaining, along with the continuation of formations (التكوينات) and colorations (التلوينات) through change and transformations (الاستحالات), so that the knowledge of the Divine Presence (الحضرة الإلهية) concerning its Might and Steadfastness may be established through them. This is what He, glory be to Him, manifested from the known things (المعلومات). Nothing else is permissible, for nothing remains except necessities (الواجبات) and impossibilities (المحالات).

The first existent that He, glory be to Him, caused to revolve was the Sphere of Indications (فلك الإشارات), a revolution of conceptual encompassing. It is the first of the contingent, originated, intelligible spheres. The first form that appeared in this Cloud-Sphere (فلك العمائي) was the form of the Immersed Spiritualities (الروحانيات المهيمات), among which is the Divine Pen (القلم الإلهي), the All-Knowing Writer of the Messages. This is the First Intellect (العقل الأول), the Effuser of wisdom and tidings. It is the Muhammadan Reality (الحقيقة المحمدية), the Real (الحق) by which creation occurred, and Justice according to the people of subtleties and indications. It is the Total Holy Spirit (الروح القدسي الكل) according to the people of Unveilings (الكشوف) and allusions. He made it knowing, preserving, subsisting, perfect, complete, effusing, and writing from the inkwell of Knowledge (العلم). The Right Hand of Power moves it, stemming from the sovereignty of Will (الإرادة) and the flowing sciences to their ends. It is the locus where the Divine Names (الأسماء الإلهيات) are established.

Then He caused the source of the Sphere of Souls (فلك النفوس) to revolve below this sphere, which is the Preserved Tablet (اللوح المحفوظ) concerning prophethoods. This is the passive Soul (النفس المنفعلة) according to the people of perceptions, indications, and unveilings (المكاشفات). He made it subsisting and perfect, but not complete, and overflowing but not effusing the effusion of the Intellect. Thus, it is in the place of deficiency and inability to reach the ultimate goals.

Then He brought into existence the Dust (الهباء) in Unveiling (الكشف), Hyle (الهيولى) in rational consideration, and Nature (الطبيعة) in minds but not in entities (الأعيان). The first form He manifested in that Dust (الهباء) was the forms of the three dimensions (الأبعاد الثلاثة), and thus Place (المكان) came to be. Upon it, He, glory be to Him, directed the sovereignty of the four elements (الأربعة الأركان). Thus appeared the fiery, earthy, airy, and watery signs of the zodiac (البروج), and the existents (الأكوان) were distinguished. This subtle, transparent, revolving body that encompasses the bodies of the World (العالم) was named the Great, Noble Throne (العرش العظيم الكريم). He established Himself upon it by His Name, the Merciful (الرحمن), an establishment transcending limit and measure, known to Him, unconditioned, and unknown to intellects and minds.

Then He, glory be to Him, caused a second sphere to revolve within this first sphere and named it the Footstool (الكرسي). The two Feet descended toward it, and in it, every wise matter was distinguished by the decree of the Mighty, the Knowing. Near it, He brought into existence the beautiful goods and the secluded maidens in the tents of the Gardens (الجنان). Then He arranged in it the stations (منازل) of all matters and perfected them in spiritualities (روحانيات) that He subjugated and ruled by the seven influences (التأثيرات السبعية), from the beginning to the hour, due to the difference of the two colors (day and night). He placed these stations between a mixed middle and two extremes: stable fortune (سعد مستقر) and continuous misfortune (نحس مستمر), by the descent of the decreed, unique human.

Then He, glory be to Him, caused a third sphere to revolve within this second sphere and created in it a swimming star, one of the retreating, sweeping stars (الخنس الكنس), subjugated and poor. He deposited with it everything pitch black, and associated with it the narrowness of paths, ruggedness, sorrow, distress, grief, the regrets of missed opportunities, the stupors of death, the secrets of darkness, the deadly deserts, the trees and fruits, the vipers and snakes, the harmful animals, the terrifying insects, the obliterated roads, and toil and hardship. And, with the assistance of the Total Soul (النفس الكلية), He created the mountains to stabilize the spread-out earths. In this sphere, He settled the spirituality of His intimate friend, Abraham, peace be upon him, His servant and Messenger.

Then He caused a fourth sphere to revolve within this sphere and created in it a swimming star, one of the retreating, sweeping stars (الخنس الكنس). He deposited with it the towering date palms, justice in judgments and governance, the causes of goodness and felicity, the beautiful, blessed white maidens, temperaments and tale-bearers, the secrets of worship and acts of nearness, demonstrative charities, luminous prayers, the answering of supplications, those looking upon those standing at Arafat, and the acceptance of rites at the place of the stoning of the Jamarāt. And, with the assistance of the Total Soul (النفس الكلية), He created the dissolution of solidified waters. In this sphere, He settled the spirituality of His Prophet Moses, peace be upon him, His servant and confidant.

Then He caused a fifth sphere to revolve within this sphere and created in it a swimming star, one of the retreating, sweeping stars (الخنس الكنس). He deposited with it the protection of doctrines by sharp, polished swords, the straight spears, the heating of firmly set cauldrons, the filling of bowls like round cisterns, fanaticism and zeal, the instigation of strife and wars between the people of guidance and the people of misguidance, and the confrontation of misleading ambiguities and clear proofs between the people of sound intellects and imaginations. And, with the assistance of the Total Soul (النفس الكل), He created the refinement of coarse airs. In this sphere, He settled the spirituality of His two Messengers, Aaron and John (Yahya), peace be upon them, the clarifiers of His two paths.

Then He caused a sixth sphere to revolve within this sphere and created in it a great, luminous, swimming star. He deposited with it the secrets of spiritualities (الروحانيات), the shining lights, the glittering radiances, the flashing lightning, the illuminating rays, the enlightened bodies, the perfect ranks (المراتب الكاملات), the balanced establishments, pearly gnoses (المعارف اللؤلؤيات), high rubies, the combination of lights and flowing secrets, the landmarks of foundations, the flowing breaths of light, the removal of governing spirits, the clarification of obscure matters, the solution of difficult problems, the beautiful placement of audition (samā‘) in melodies, the succession of divine inspirations (الواردات), the continuous descent of unseen manifestations (التنزلات الغيبيات), the ascent of spiritual stations to the peak of ultimate ends, the repulsion of ailments by beneficial remedies, the commendable words, fragrant perfumes, and similar things whose mention would be lengthy, a portion of which we have mentioned in Chapter Forty-Six of the book *Al-Tanazzulāt al-Mawṣiliyyāt*. And, with the assistance of the Total Soul (النفس الكل), He created the movement of the Aether Sphere to heat the World (العالم) with these motions. In this sphere, He settled Idris the Prophet, who was specialized in the High Place.

Then He caused a seventh sphere to revolve within this sphere and created in it a swimming star, one of the retreating, sweeping stars (الخنس الكنس). He deposited with it perfect formation (التصوير التام), beautiful order, delightful audition, the splendid, beautiful sight, awe, beauty, intimacy (الأنس), and majesty (الجلال). And, with the assistance of the Total Soul (النفس الكل), He created the distillation of moist water from the element of vapors. In this sphere, He settled the spirituality of the beautiful, perfect Prophet Joseph, peace be upon him.

Then He caused an eighth sphere to revolve within this sphere and created in it a swimming star, one of the retreating, sweeping stars (الخنس الكنس). He deposited with it illusions (الأوهام) and the causing of illusion (الإيهام), revelation (الوحي) and inspiration (الإلهام), the pitfalls of corrupt opinions and analogies, bad dreams, glad tidings, industrial inventions, practical derivations, the errors and correctness found in thoughts, active powers, illusory matters, prohibition, soothsaying, physiognomy, magic, incantations, and talismans. And, with the assistance of the Total Soul (النفس الكل), He created the mixing of moist vapors with dry vapors. In this sphere, He settled the spirituality of His Spirit and His Word, Jesus, peace be upon him, His servant, Messenger, and the son of His maidservant.

Then He caused another, ninth sphere to revolve within this sphere and created in it a swimming star. Allah deposited with it increase and decrease, swelling, and transformations (الاستحالات) through decay. And, with the assistance of the Total Soul (النفس الكل), He created the supply of generated things (المولدات) with the element of saps. In this sphere, He settled the spirituality of His Prophet Adam, peace be upon him, His servant, Messenger, and chosen one.

He settled in these revolving spheres various kinds of angels, the rankers and the reciters. Among them are those standing and those sitting, and among them are those bowing and those prostrating, as the Exalted said, informing about them: <<وَمَا مِنَّا إِلَّا لَهُ مَقَامٌ مَعْلُومٌ>> (And there is none of us except that he has a known station). They are the inhabitants of the heavens. He made some of them the purified spirits (الأرواح المطهرات) who seclude themselves in the noblest Presences (الحضرات). He made some of them the subjugated angels and the agents over the formations (التكوينات) that Allah creates. He appointed the angels who drive away (الزاجرات) to the regions, the angels who are sent (المرسلات) to the tidings, the angels who cast (الملقيات) inspiration (الإلهام) and suggestions (اللمات), the angels who divide (المقسمات) for detailing, forming, and arranging, the angels who spread (الناشرات) encouragement and welcome, the angels who draw out (الناشطات) warning, the angels who pull out (النازعات) dispersion, the angels who swim (السابحات) for driving, the angels who precede (السابقات) for attention, and the angels who dispose (المدبرات) for rulings.

Then He caused the Sphere of the Aether to revolve within this sphere, depositing in it the return of the eavesdroppers (المسترقات) who strike. Then, below it, He placed the Sphere of Air, in which He caused the scattering winds (الذاريات), the violent winds (العاصفات), the preceding winds (السابقات), the bearing winds (الحاملات), and the rain-producing clouds (المعصرات) to flow. In it, He caused the surging seas, which are transformations (المستحيلات) originating from vapors, to wave. This is called the circle of the Sphere of Extreme Cold (الزمهرير), from which the art of distillation is learned. In this sphere, He held the spirits of flying bodies. In these two spheres, He manifested the crashing thunder (الرعود القاصفات), the flashing lightning (البروق الخاطفات), the deadly thunderbolts (الصواعق المهلكات), the killing stones, the towering mountains, the fiery spirits ascending and descending, and the solidified waters.

Then He caused a sphere to revolve within this sphere, in which He, glory be to Him, deposited what He informed us of in the clear verses concerning the secrets of reviving the dead, and in which He caused the flowing signs to run, and settled the silent animals. Then He caused another sphere to revolve within it, in which He deposited the various kinds of formations (التكوينات): minerals, plants, and animals. As for minerals, He, the Mighty and Majestic, made them three layers: watery, earthy, and stony. Likewise, plants include those that sprout, those that are planted, and those that are sown. Likewise, animals include those that are born, those that suckle, those that hatch, and those that are generated from decay.

Then He formed the human, making him analogous to all the originated things we have mentioned. Then He bestowed upon him the landmarks of the Names (الأسماء) and Attributes (الصفات). These miraculous creations were thus prepared for him. For this reason, he was the last of the existents: through his spirituality, the secret of priority (الأولية) was established for him in the beginnings; and through his corporeality, posteriority (الآخرية) was established for him in the ends. By him, the Command began and was sealed, in manifestation of Divine Care (العنايات). He established him as a Caliph (خليفة) on Earth because it contains what is in the heavens. He supported him with signs, indications, proofs, and miracles, and specialized him with various kinds of spiritual gifts (الكرامات). Through him, He established the prescribed judgments, so that Allah might distinguish the wicked from the good, joining the wicked to wretchedness in the lowest levels (الدركات) and joining the good to felicity in the highest levels (الدرجات), as preceded concerning the two Hands (القبضتين), which are two Attributes (صفتان) of the Essence (الذات). Glory be to the Originator of these signs and the Establisher of these proofs, demonstrating that He is One, the Subduer of the earth and the heavens.

This is the arrangement of the structure (نضد) of the World (العالم) according to a specific method unique to some rational thinkers. After the poem I am about to mention, we will mention what they agreed with us upon. As for our own arrangement of it, also according to another method concerning the initial placement, know that this is the poem:

> Praise be to Allah, by whose Existence (وجوده)
> Existence (الوجود) and the World of Immersion (عالم الهيمان) appeared.
> And the Highest Element, by whose Existence
> The essences of the worlds of contingency (عوالم الإمكان) appeared.
> Without arrangement, so there is no prior
> In it, nor any posterior in the moment.
> Until the Guardian (al-Muhaymin) willed to see
> What was known of the existents (الأكوان).
> The Powerful opened the worlds of the Register
> With the existence of a Spirit, then a second Spirit.
> Then the Dust (الهباء), likewise Hyle (الهيولى), then a body receptive
> To the worlds of the spheres and the elements (الأركان).
> So He caused it to revolve as a great sphere, whose name is
> The Noble Throne (العرش الكريم), where the Merciful established Himself.
> Following it is the Footstool (كرسي), the division of His Speech
> From whose divisions the two Feet appear.
> After it is the Sphere of the Zodiac, and after it
> The Sphere of the Stars, the source of times.
> Then the descent, along with the void, to a center
> To establish therein the foundations of the structure.
> So He caused the Earth to revolve, then Water above it
> The Sphere of Air and the element of Fires.
> Above it is the Sphere of the Crescent (Moon), and above it
> A sphere attributed to the Scribe of the Register (Mercury).
> Above it is the Sphere of Venus, and above it
> The Sphere of the Gazelle (Sun), the source of the two colors (day/night).
> Above it is Mars, then Jupiter
> Then that which is attributed to Kaywān (Saturn).
> And for every body, according to its nature, He wills
> A creation called the Luminous World (العالم النوراني).
> They are the noble angels, whose motto is
> The preservation of Existence (الوجود) from His Name, the Benefactor (المحسان).
> They moved toward perfection, and gave birth
> Upon moving, to the world of Satan.
> Then the minerals and the plants, and after them
> Came to us the worlds of the animals.
> And the ultimate goal is the manifestation of our bodies
> In the world of composition and physical forms.
> When its elements were balanced and perfected
> God breathed the subtlety of the human.
> And clothed him in His image, so he became a Caliph (خليفة)
> To whom the angels and the two weighty ones (humans and jinn) submit.
> And by the revolution of the encompassing sphere and its ruling
> He manifested to us in the world of origination.
> In the core of this Earth, black water
> Foul for the people of polytheism and transgression.
> It flows upon the surface of the winds, and near it
> Are the darknesses of the wrath of the Subduer, the Judge.
> They revolved around the rock of the center of His sovereignty
> The Divine Spirit (الروح الإلهي), mighty in status.

This is the arrangement of the placement upon which Allah originated the World (العالم) initially.

[The Differentiation in Known Things]

Know that the differentiation (التفاضل) in known things, based on their existence, is most generally defined by influence (التأثير).
